a6Frnz84MJQcHL-BFSqnnQ.review_text: Walking distance from our hotel. Had breakfast here every morning. The quiche was very filling and the coffee was hot and strong!

WNtaVotVPF7_Pvycj7jlQw.review_text: I order the salmon bagels that were yummy! they were not joking with the capers. not the BEST bagel ever... orange juice was fresh squeezed as promised. latte was amazing and the oatmeal was quite delicious! over all not bad at all :) and not bad prices either!

rVWebsft_jx629iCO6vQ5w.review_text: A refreshing surprise for being so close to such a painfully tacky/touristy part of town. The hummus was "meh", but the pitta chips were very good (seemed home-made). Delicious salad and coffee with nice outside seating. The cappuccino was beautifully crafted and the buffalo Mozzarella made me kinda weak in the knees.

KxBYaUy007O8hl0LjIVnow.review_text: You won't find a better cafe in san francisco. The food is fresh with a limited but good offering, the lattes are phenomenal and working from the cafe is pleasant as the whir of the coffee bean grinder, the tap-tap-tap as the grinds are placed into the brewer and then the spit of the foamer becomes a rhythmic background beat. If I could only patron a few places in San Francisco for the rest of my life, this would be one of them.

HQJWm2KJIgZX2YSxhCsz_w.review_text: The staff at this cafe were very nice. However: this place was a complete disappointment.  They got most aspects of our order wrong and worst of all the espresso drinks were un-drinkable. Much better cappuccinos around the corner at DeLise.

F1sBzL5e596rE-Qof5vJPQ.review_text: Love this place! Great quality, awesome service, free wifi, and great food. A place for a true European Coffee lover.  I would recommend a cappucino or espresso.  If you are not in a coffee mood, the italian sodas are amazing.    The proscuitto is cut perfectly and so tasty. The mozzarella is amazingly fresh.   The one thing I really appreciate about this place is the owner's values.  I had the pleasure of speaking with him once and he places so much value in quality its refreshing.  Take that Starbucks.

sAqu1ueoTR-eK8rQiFkO0w.review_text: Mocha is pretty good! They make it with the pretty design on top. Their sandwiches and paninis are decent too. Taste very fresh and healthy. I like their smoked salmon bagel. Free wifi, a little hard tk find parking bc hey, its north beach. 3 stars as is. 4 stars if u come w a yelp or restaurant.com deal.

YLy6HF5gqPjDgoT9VO5ZeQ.review_text: My favorite cafe in North Beach! The bagels and coffee are spectacular, magazines are available if you are alone, wifi, and staff is really nice! The only reason for the 4 stars is that the armchairs inside are lopsided and uncomfortable, probably because they are just way too old, but otherwise the place has a good atmosphere.

bOHNFwu8qAvWrzENXfihBg.review_text: this was my go-to cafe when i was working in the area.  the roast beef & cheddar melt was delicious every time.  delicious coffee and friendly staff.  quiet, relaxing place away from tourists to read a book or do some work.  good memories.

Q9HjjoP9h6rioykrlJHW-Q.review_text: I've been here a couple of times, and I always love the atmosphere. It's very relaxing, and there's free Wi-fi, so it's a great place to study.  BUT ("[someone] once told me that nothing someone says before the word 'but' really counts")  They are quite racist here. My girlfriend ordered a chai latte, and we had to go get it from the counter ourselves. The lady (a different ethnicity than us) at the table adjacent to ours ordered a macchiato... but she got it hand delivered. She also ordered a slice of pie... and got that delivered as well (both by different servers). And she got a heart in it.  Still coming back for the cozy setting, but you'd expect better treatment from a cafe in San Francisco. Guess discrimination never goes out of style.

Px7Wv8upFSmB4660i9bOsg.review_text: Cute and comfortable for eats and wifi. We spent an entire day here sipping, noshing and surfing. Plus 5 for amenities and -1 for proximity to the next table. Yummy food, drinks and service.

f0zVd5ka27C9Z3b4eSg8WA.review_text: This is a good place, but gets 3 stars because it is EXTREMELY expensive, especially for what you get.

Rb6CkEdMjzG0umjXpHnzGA.review_text: The menu was simple and easy. Not much variety but you know what you're going to get when you walk in.

-mnri72wyFTXyBVWvosa6A.review_text: We wanted to sit down for a cup off coffee walking away from pier 39 and walking towards Chinatown we found this small coffee shop, which is hard now to find  Wonderful service and nice variety of coffee and espresso.

A4hD7UPCqliXcWtAq1XXIw.review_text: Great mocha and good atmosphere.  Found this place when i was in the area.  Needed coffee and a place to sit so i could work (free wifi helped!)

bzLY-VVHEF_Kcig1TTa5SA.review_text: I'm sad. Not only a bad day for the economy, but a bad day for the cafe culture in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I have been going to Cafe Capriccio a few days a week for the past few months and *looked* forward to it everytime.  This cafe had the best food and really felt like a cafe in Europe because of the ambiance and food quality.   Much to my dismay, I walked in today and was greeted by a new menu and new owners.  The menu had a few of the same items, but overall it was dramatically different. They took a lot of the really great salads (NICOISE) and paninis off the menu and don't appear to have a special of the day which was always tasty.     Trying to be an optimist, I ordered the Chicken and Bacon salad to go for $8.95.  When I opened it, I was very disappointed to see there was NO BACON.  It was basically iceburg lettuce, tomato and chicken for $8.95. I also bit into a piece of chicken that was crunchy like bone - not a good!  I really hope the owners can make some tweaks and bring back the same food quality of the previous cafe.

T6SuLkeGko0shJacHYWq6g.review_text: This was the first place I ate when I got to San Francisco.  Minus three stars because my bread was a little too 'chewy' (still can't quite describe it), but plus one star because the folks behind the counter were so nice.  In fact, they still waved at me and said hi whenever I walked by for about a week after my first visit.

16p3QHTNAk8dDKVsv8eWdw.review_text: As good as a cafe gets as far as I'm concerned,.. Very comfortable atmosphere..

JSZXi3bT-cyvQZKw6HlEAw.review_text: Horrible staff!!!!!  Did not acknowledge us until they noticed we had a stroller!!!  Didn't bother to stay!!!!  How did this place receive a 4-star rating?!?!?!

1RrUhnJh4KWu1BOrEE6WlQ.review_text: oh, cafe capriccio, how i love thee....let me count the ways:  1. you're almost within spitting distance, if i were one to spit, from my residence 2. your almond torte is no less than divine 3. your hot chocolate isn't too bad, either 4. your husband and wife owners are so very pleasant and lovely, even at the very end of a long day, when the wife half has food stuck in her hair 5. seeing people sitting outside drinking coffee and working on laptops is such a brilliant change from seeing the woman with loofahs in her hair sleeping on the front steps  i'm sure there will be more, but we've just recently become acquainted.  bellisimo.

DHFqJbIP6kUISL8N989Kew.review_text: While day-tripping alone in SFO, super-friendly old woman struck a conversation with me and during the conversation, she advised me to go walk down the hill to north beach and enjoy the best espresso in the city at Capriccio. I am so glad, I checked it out!  One of the best cappuccinos that I ever had!   It is a cute little neighborhood cafe with a casual ambiance! There is some outdoor seating as well! The indoor seating is cozy and comfy with a homey feeling! They have free wi-fi and a lot of electrical outlets!    I had a cappuccino and a panini. I wanted to try their baked goods but they ran out of all their pastries...I mean literally every thing by mid-afternoon. So I am assuming that they must be yummy!  Cappuccino, as I said was super yummy. I am satisfied with the vegetarian caprese sandwich too!  The Italian bread was fresh and very tasty.  Even the side salad that came with the sandwich was delicious!  I would definitely go to this cafe next time I am in north beach area!

DtAoj040upAMISrQoi1D1A.review_text: LOVE THIS PLACE.  We were totally doing the lame tourist thing and had spent a couple of hours wandering around Fisherman's Wharf.  We wanted to find a nice little place away from the CRAZINESS of the wharf to have some wine or some nice coffee, and we stumbled across this place by accident.  It looked really inviting, and there were people sitting outside sipping white wine.  SOLD.  We darted in.  The wine was really reasonably priced, and they had a nice little selection.  $18 for a bottle of chilled, cheap local Chard?  SOLD.  We expected it to taste a little cheap, but it was AWESOME.  Honestly, one of the best cheapo bottles of white I've ever tasted.  We hung out at a sidewalk table, and it was a perfect end to the afternoon.  This place is a gem, and you should check it out if you are in that area and need a nice place to go and relax with a coffee or glass of wine.

XATAGil0UThklr_eGzI-EA.review_text: A tucked away neighborhood coffee shop that I cherish! Good service and decent selection on the lunch menu.  And I love their location.  It's in the touristy part of the neighborhood but it's by the residential area so it's still quiet and it's not flooded with tourists like the other cafes.  On nice days like what we've lately, it's so nice to sit outside and have conversations with friends over coffee or wine.   (yes, they also serve wine!).

etwWZaxtOpOYvHivWNIqOw.review_text: Good local corner bakery.  Probably worth hoofing it from Touristman's Wharf hotels and getting something a little more authentic than Starbucks (but then again, if you chose to stay at the Hyatt or the Ramada or whatever, you get what you deserve).  Coffee was great (although they ran out surprisingly fast) and there were a ton of great pastries and sandwiches - I was a pretty big fan of their chocolate croissant.  I feel kind of bad about our stay, though - we got up at 6 AM and were wandering around looking for a place to eat.  Wound up here at 7 sharp and mentioned to the clerk how weird it was to have nothing open early.  The next day, she opened up at 6:30 - but we didn't roll in until almost 8.  Oops!  Great service, great atmosphere, great coffee, great food - it's no wonder it served as our de facto "base of operations" for our stay in the area.  Crowd seemed mostly local, although there were a few stragglers (like us) who were staying at the San Remo.  The free wi-fi was what initially led us there, but the greatness of everything else kept bringing us back.

62jaRNAFPQWz-SKmNubPHg.review_text: Its really nice and Im here now at Cafe Capriccio now owned by Alex a lady and she is doing this with Jessie her partner. Its really nice and I did not like the original cafe. The food was not good for me - I eat low fat and its more difficult to make plates that are low in fat cause you dont have the advantage of the flavor of meat or cheese so the food has to be naturally fine. This is. They went to Coffee school in Portland and this is good espresso.  I didnt like the original owners and these people are really nice. I think the original owners had a lot of difficult to get the place open and by time it was they were already planning their exit...  J

JpwaSyhREorkzcItT8M58Q.review_text: We were around the corner staying at the Hyatt looking for a breakfast spot offering more than the typical eggs and bacon.  This place did not disappoint.  Our kids indulged in their yogurt parfait and we also had a bagel w/Roma tomatoes, onions and capers - yum!  All in all, skip the busy breakfast diners and try this place!

U400x0nnIYl4WrVNdrM1HA.review_text: I should have written a review of this place along time ago. The staff is super sweet, the ambiance is nice and it is a great refuge from work. They are not uptight about dogs. The honey-pear salad is amazing and the vegan donuts are a great low-guilt dessert. A really good spot to chill out and get some writing/thinking done, at least that's what I do there. Inviting, warm and unpretentious vibe. When it's warm enough to sit outside it is particularly special.

LbRZeU6PVYrqFasK8YNysg.review_text: Living in North Beach this was my absolute favorite cafe.  Delicious lattes, tasty food and friendly staff.  Loved getting work done here because the seats are comfortable and they have plenty of outlets.  They also outdoor seating which is nice on a sunny day.

g3-4LSFaRu_mDMFg6-SX5w.review_text: Espresso has definitely improved each time I've visited! Very nice spot to relax or work.  Beautiful decor, and sandwiches/deserts are excellent.  Currently this is my favorite in SF -- meets all my requirements: awesome espresso drinks, dependable wi-fi, and chill (not elevator) music.  I work via laptop 7 days a week, so while the fact that I don't want to listen to punk in a cafe may not be hip -- hey, I do what I gotta do.  There's a time and a place for everything... ;-)

lhKV2lxaPG4EJEsXqISDxQ.review_text: Amazing: it looks like these guys lived in europe coz they perfectly know the taste of coffee, cappuccino and croissant. Stop goin to starbucks and head here!

jYowMfO4Gzh_kuwgFS_oyA.review_text: The best espresso I've ever had. Not kidding. Cafe Capriccio also (and not surprisingly) makes an amazing Americano, which I'm embarrassed to admit may be my favorite type of coffee these days. There's is so flavorful and delicious I think I may be forever spoiled.  I've now been here multiple times, and am able to report that the food is delicious as well. They make a delicious roast beef and cheese panini made with a thick baguette bread that kept me full all day; the vegetarian caprese sandwich is also great. They serve it up with thick slices of mozzarella, tomato, and pesto sauce with a side salad, and I was sad when it was gone. I may have even licked my fingers. My friend tried the quiche - a bold move, since it's such a hit-or-miss kind of dish - but we both agreed that it was cheesy deliciousness.  The ambiance is casual and quiet; even when it's crowded, most people are on their computers. There's a larger table for groups, and outdoor seating is plentiful and lovely on sunny days. If you're in the 'hood and want to escape (or, even better, avoid) the hubbub of Fisherman's Wharf, put this cafe on your list.

FSFdLiR-cB8q4ObQY20aWA.review_text: The best coffee !!!!!  The coffee not only tastes fantastic but it looks beautiful as well. Friendly service, wifi and good chocolate croissants .

1K9Q7aOho-pSvGSNs29dEA.review_text: Alex and Jessie have picked up right where Terrick and Lisa left off in giving great food and service in an excellent, relaxing environment. The cafe is bright and open, and they now have extended hours. The new phone number is 415.772.0937, I noticed the Yelp page still has the old one.

jdPe7-jiG7YHtha0W3UVOw.review_text: It's a small, neighborhood cafe. Reminds me of the East Village back home. It was outside of the tourist crowds, so that was good.

-z8Z93iq1b5WJpRcibdI0A.review_text: Bravo to the new ownership. I do love the coffee. I was told it was Ecco from Santa Rosa. The muffins and pastries are very good. This is a great place to have lunch as well.

1JCoWx4tFjyWS9T0RN2u8Q.review_text: You know when you begin drafting your reviews on Yelp? Well for those who have never written a review, you begin by choosing a star rating and when you hover over 5 stars, the caption next to it says, "As good as it gets!" Well Cafe Capriccio really and truly is as good as it gets!  I first happened into this cafe as a North Beach resident out for a stroll, and since then, every other cafe & coffee house has had to measure up to Cafe Capriccio.  The atmosphere is pleasant, and comfortable. On the walls, featured artists exhibit their works, local magazines and publications sit on the racks - waiting there to be thumbed through, and music from Pandora stations drift over the sounds of coffee grinders and conversation. There are a few tables available inside with more tables & chairs available outside on the sidewalk. The workers here are friendly but reserved. Don't mistake their pleasant peace as anything more than an appreciation and respect for the personal space of patrons that choose to begin their day here. Come in, smile, place an order, sit, eat, drink and appreciate!  This little cafe is a crossroads of culture from the diverse mix of local residents, to the steady stream of tourists who bravely stray from their guide maps and happen into this oasis. It became a great routine to my day when I would walk in, grab a cappuccino and a breakfast wrap then sit outside and watch the neighborhood wake up.  I recommend the breakfast wrap with either ham, or bacon or for some lighter fare enjoy one of their well portioned parfaits. Go in knowing that their menu doesn't offer a full array of breakfast & lunch items, but everything prepared here is divine.  They also have a beer & wine license!

jYCBDI70jgsG5GCQ__N-vA.review_text: (Insert usual lament about lack of options when it comes to lunch places around work)  This is such a cute little local cafe!  You will always see people happily working on their laptops, enjoying a coffee, iced tea, or sandwich.  Sometimes this can make it difficult to get a table, but it's good to see it busy!  There is also plenty of seating outdoors if it's a nice day.  My coworkers love the pear salad.  I'm not a salad girl, so I get the roast beef sandwich with cheese.  Oh, it is GOOD.  I also thoroughly enjoy their selection of vegan donuts.  Uh huh, I just wrote vegan donuts.  Try it before you wrinkle your nose!  They have a raspberry one that is yummy, and I feel slightly less guilty eating it because it's vegan, and therefore healthy, and low calorie.  Oh, that's not what vegan means? Whatever.  And the iced tea is SO good. I'm not even big on iced tea and I crave it.  I always add a splenda out of habit but I think I could definitely drink it without.  The service has always been friendly, even when I pout in the rare event that they have run out of iced tea.

_LyPshyvi6c1wT9v1e2OPg.review_text: The female barista is so very sweet and friendly, and she makes a mean cup of chai.  There is plenty of seating and lots of outlets (yay!), perfect for having some coffee and snacks and getting a lot of work done.  And free wi-fi!  Minus a star because the benches/cushions/window looked like it could use some serious dusting/PineSol.

L9IPOUR3CyM9Z9H7BQKd6Q.review_text: Really great coffee here--nice and strong. It's a cute place, with a friendly atmosphere and free wi-fi. A lot of the people seem to be regulars.  I just upgraded them to four stars after having the breakfast parfait. I expected to get a premade blueberry/strawberry layered thing in a plastic cup like most coffeeshops. Instead, she cut up fresh fruit right then, at least five or six different kinds. Delicious, and actually worth $5, unlike other places. My only complaint? They insist on leaving their front double doors open at all times. I know it's California, but it is 45 degrees out people! Obviously the owner is nice and toasty, wearing a t-shirt behind the counter, and he doesn't seem to notice that all of his customers are still wearing their jackets inside. I don't think I'll be back until it gets warm out again. Their outdoor seating looks nice and sunny.

TU1i5AMZxrtyNCVpgUC_zA.review_text: Ten years living in North Beach and that spot is finally something to love. I am still sampling the food to see if I have a favorite, although today I had a Tunisian Salad (in it were egg, beets, artichoke, pickled carrots, and like 10 other things) for the first time and loved it.  The whole place has a great vibe, whether you're sitting outside in the sunny chairs, or inside at a comfy table. But the owners Tarek and Lisa make the place wonderful and warm. I love how the place attracts a diversity of people--- you'll hear Arabic, French, and Italian spoken there. It's feels so much more like Europe to me than the Disneyland version up on Columbus.  They are still sorting out the menu and hiring new staff, so bring some patience just in case.

7r4dPb5OUwao6nJ4DZegNA.review_text: We definitely had very tasty mochas there - our favorite of the 3 coffeehouses we tried while in SF.  We didn't explore the menu but the breakfast bagels were yummy and it was a comfy place to enjoy our breakfast.

MhTnja4xyolJEFBapjiTlQ.review_text: Any morning that I'm at work, my half hour break is always spent at Capriccio.  Damn fine coffee.  Damn fine.  The staff is comprised of good folks who know how to make good coffee.  The atmosphere is relaxed, but that's not to say it's not always full of people expecting good coffee.  They're busy for a reason.  If I lived in the neighborhood you'd see me in there every morning.  With that said, I've worked across the street from the place for two and a half years now, and I can say from experience that the new management is infinitely improved over the old management.  May as well be a different place.

zy2cNfG4lLE3SlY9p2OL-A.review_text: Kudos for the free internet access, (which should be a standard in cafe's as tables and chairs are).  I like the very cozy location, nestled within inner North Beach.  Staff was wonderful; coffee drinks need an upgrade.

UHd3D1tq_hjlWGgkugQfmw.review_text: The best priced cafe food I've ever seen at a coffee shop.

30MGqoQBmgZ1e8K2T_jNHg.review_text: i have been here a few times, usually just for the drip coffee which is average..i mean, it's drip coffee. if it's not completely watered down i'm going to like it. i did try the nicoise(sp??) salad here which was good, their salami panini wasn't bad,  but didn't exactly rock my world either, the chicken pesto sandwich with goat cheese is pretty tasty. too much bread though..but i'm not much of a sandwich person anyway, and i like paninis with really pressed or thin bread so i can taste the insides. i do really like the employees. they have consistently been very friendly, and attentive. you can tell that they are making a real effort to give you a good experience, so i give em props.

z0bWP4WUSaj22b69pT6LEw.review_text: Worst service ever. Food was all right but there was a lady who clearly should be fired: mean, talking about customers with kitchen people right in front of the customers, not taking orders properly. Can't recommend this place to anyone.

kaeGADArxxh_V8lRjsnMaQ.review_text: This place have the best smoke salmon Bagel, it is a nice place to be at in the morning, nice relaxing place to have a nice hot cappuccino.

EuWRgm2NGa3KLNG2zSUJ-Q.review_text: Coffee = OK Proscuitto di Parma Panini = 5 Stars. Just around the corner = Fantastic.

UBAfc-KuDXV8XLurou_i6g.review_text: Very low-key place to get yourself a coffee, chai or small meal (good salads & sandwiches). Free wifi so great place to, I don't know, job hunt online these days.

XsmCflJwEbBKShKXNCaiwQ.review_text: I have had lunch at Cafe Capriccio twice. I love their salad - both quality and quantity. Also their fresh squeezed orange juice is awesome!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: I feel like Matthew R and I were on the "Douchebag-free Tour Of North Beach" last week. I am simply amazed, awed, and dumbstruck by the sheer douche-free nature of the places we went with family from out-of-town. See, my brother and sister-in-law are stoners. Because they're stoners, they didn't want to venture too far from their hotel (in case they wanted to get stoned again) for dinner or breakfast (stoners!). This actually worked out in our favor.  Capriccio is a cute little corner cafe with the usual coffee, espresso and pastries...but wait! There's more! Even a stoner can satisfy those munchies at a place like this. They have omelettes and salads and fresh fruit (yes, it comes with whipped cream, you stoner!). If you, like Matthew and I, are not of the stoner persuasion but indeed fancy yourself a bit of a morning boozer, Capriccio has your hungover ass covered with mimosas, too!  I had the fruit, boy had the lox bagel, and stoned and stoneder had the omelettes and something else. All was delicious and the mimosa had just enough champagne to take the edge off. Prices are great and the service can't be beat. This is truly a neighborhood gem. But don't drive here...just trust me on this.

uzdUXO3OPI2Czt14aUrDvg.review_text: Recently I've needed to find a cozy cafe with free WiFi and after many failed attempts, Cafe Capricco has become my new favorite.  You can sip on a rich cappuccino, enjoy one of their many great paninis or indulge in a sweet treat. The turkey panini is perfect for lunch and comes with a side salad.  It has a relaxed atmosphere and the service is attentive, but not pushy.  I never feel as though I've overstayed my welcome, as you might at other cafes in the area.  And although it's in Northbeach, it's enough off the beaten path of Colombus to cater more toward a local crowd.

QiU3oQxR0eoGfMLY1_d9pg.review_text: Decent place to drink coffee and work, but nothing spectacular.

A_BT4EcxzNj-vNXlefXOPA.review_text: Came here because of the good reviews on the coffee and its coupon deal. $10 for $15. The cafe staff's service/friendliness varies. Had one with less than average attitude, and one (Asian guy) who were very helpful and friendly. The attitude was quite a contrast.   My friends and I ordered 2 lattes and 2 berry pie. The coffee was okay, the pie was made locally, a bit on the tart side which i'm guessing because they didn't load it with excess sugar, which i liked. They got one of the lattes wrong, the nicer staff easily replaced it with a new one.  I was expecting quite a bit from the good reviews, but one of the staff there let a star down.

PiwOtgwtLWfLjbLMHRkAdg.review_text: I wasn't a huge fan of this place previously.  The regular coffee was WEAK, and the service was hit or miss.... Tarek was always very friendly though. I've been a couple of times since the ownership change and the coffee is much better.  I really like french press.  I have yet to try the food but the menu looks great!  The owner is very nice and she really wants to please the customers.  I hope they do well!!!

Vy_UStnQ2CCebOYJDsB6CA.review_text: What WAS a super friendly, cozy, wonderful place to get a cup of coffee and relax on any given morning has become just another crap-hole coffee house.  Since new owners took over, it's just not the same - from the loud, obnoxious music  to the rude staff, our Sunday morning coffee ritual will be changing for sure. Huge mistake in the changes, this place will be going under soon. Thanks but no thanks, Cafe Capriccio!

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: 3.5 stars  It's a nice neighborhood cafe with outdoor seating.  I actually like the indoor space - there's the cozy corner bench seatings inside and the large communal table in the front next to the window.  The menu is up above behind the counter with a separate blackboard with wine list.  You can help yourself with water - glasses and pitcher of iced water at the counter at your convenience.    I wanted to go to a homey cafe for a bottomless cup of coffee since the morning...but one thing led to another and I didn't make it to anywhere.  With the cravings still going strong, I was happy they were still open and still willing to make me a breakfast bagel w/ eggs, cheese and ham.  With limited selection on bagel, I asked if I can have it on toast instead and they were kind enough to accommodate.    We sat at the communal table facing the mirror - it's a good spot to people watch from the inside.  I had my cup of coffee, the ham, egg, cheese w/ fresh tomato sandwich and hubby had a glass of fresh oj.  The oj was very good, quite sweet.  A man who seems like a regular took a seat at the table and he ordered the caprese salad?  It looked really good with a very generous portion of mixed greens topped with sunflower and pumpkin seeds, raisins, tomato and mozzarella.    Look forward to returning, staying longer and enjoying some time here.

q1zJqtcuRob_tk-2BajInA.review_text: This was my favorite hang out spot while staying in Fisherman's Wharf. The coffee was delicious and I liked that they had good breakfast and lunch options, wine included. I spent most of my time inside reading my book and enjoying the music and free wi-fi, but the outdoor seating is nice too. Great if you want to get away from the chain coffee shops.

sXKmP90GCdF0oM0AzYRhaQ.review_text: You're not too far from Little Italy, but if you care how smooth the frothing of your milk is, how great the barista is, come here. :) It couldn't be any better than any other cafes in north beach.

HrQVsvm3xcSxVPjry7Mjow.review_text: Horrible service. We stood in front of the register for a solid 5-10 minutes with no acknowledgement. When we came to order we were told that literally half the menu was not available. The kitchen looked dirty and most of the tables had dirty plates and cups sitting out. I was hopeful about trying something good here after seeing some of these reviews but quite frankly I don't understand how anyone had a pleasant experience here.

MQ4zjQaaaAxorJPs31Cjaw.review_text: Cafe Capriccio is an outstanding cafe and experience for anyone with class, sophisticated style and educated palate.  Based on my experiences and dining with chefs, I determine high value and appreciation for the simplicity and excellent creation.  The cafe is to the way foods are high quality as in Switzerland and Italy.    It is a hidden secret, jewel and a breath of fresh air just outside of North Beach's hustle and bustle.  Unlike most cafes in San Francisco, it is very clean and maintained.  The service is always great.  Owners and employees are genuinely friendly and professional.

jChwEu0CoI54qyuVnmIxmQ.review_text: This place is very mellow. Good for grabbing a cup coffee, glass of wine, sandwich, or breakfast bagel. Staff is very friendly. Free Wi-Fi, tons of outlets, and seating with pillows . Great for some studying or reading/relaxing will be back for sure!

M8ZleqEPZWfxWXxZR0lJ2Q.review_text: exiled to the land of no good coffee, i finally turned to coffeeratings.com for help. okay, i'm still closer to blue bottle in the ferry building than i am to capriccio, but it's a much nicer walk, and no insane line of tourists to deal with, and the espresso is really quite good. coffeeratings.com/review…

kivPWpDeplRfJCvVNAH1uQ.review_text: Horrible experience here! Get to the front of the line only to find out the menu that is clearly stated on the wall is completely inaccurate as they are "selling the business" the woman making coffee is completely rude as she tells the cashier "you don't need to explain it to them". Will NOT be coming back!!

98ayax82c8mMTgxgkIw3Zw.review_text: Cafe Capriccio has been through so many ownership changes since my last review. The atmosphere and the food have declined so much in quality that even though we live steps from the cafe we never go in, not even for coffee. The last several times we patronized Capriccio it was clear that the turnover of the staff is high. There was never  a manager around. Previous owners were onsite nearly every day. Staff were rude or indifferent. We wonder how they stay in business now. The presence of the San Remo Hotel across the street which does not serve breakfast probably contributes to some of Capriccio's staying power - at least during the early morning hours.

BOkvZ2zPzBjDoH5jo3bvkw.review_text: This place seems like it's changed hands again. The sandwich menu is the same, but they are using lesser quality ingredients(cheap processed roast beef, for example) and less of them. I ordered the roast beef panini today and it was very disappointing, a shadow of its former self, but the high price was still the same. Coffees are still ok.

HrSXe9zZqYpXVRtUv8X4Pg.review_text: I ordered the smoked salmon bagel and a hot chocolate.  The salmon was not good.  When I say "not good," I don't mean "didn't taste good," I mean the meat they used was rotten.  I had someone take a bite of it to make sure, and they agreed it was no good.  Also from the color of the meat, I could tell the fish was farmed...I don't know why any restaurant that resides in the bay would use farmed fish (farmed fish are full of antibiotics, pesticides, and disease from living in cramped pools).  The hot chocolate was really good though.    Kind of pricey for such a weeny bagel, but the service was really good, so 2 stars.

l0ITWlrwFr-27Zg-iTBtig.review_text: Fantastic service and quaint atmosphere. Very relaxed and quiet to allow you to get a bit of work done on their FREE WIFI!!  Beautiful presentation and quality ingredients.  Try the lunch special pictured below consisting of half salad and cup of soup.  Latte was amazing and cappuccino was exquisite. I will make every effort to return before my trip ends.  Try it for yourself.  You will not be disappointed.  A must try for tourists and locals alike.

hLvInByM9UGS13NEaWnH8g.review_text: This is a wonderful and quiet cafe that serves really good espresso drinks. I came here on a weekday with high expectations. First off, the cafe has a nice European air about it, with plenty of outside seating. My cappuccino had nice art, good texture and was only a little bit light on the flavor side of things. I asked where they get their beans from, but I think the barista thought I said meat because he told me Boar's Head. I didn't want to press the issue, so I have no idea. Anyway, it's really good. I'll be back again when I want to sit for a nice espresso drink.

BIIavsSgGqbN_c-lsbkDsg.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
BIIavsSgGqbN_c-lsbkDsg.review_text: My latte was the perfect temperature.  The outside seating is nice on a sunny day.  Inside was very busy.

ML_tl5mQ9ThxXNXyKn-NpA.review_text: This review only pertains to the panini   I had the roast beef melt here and it is quite dry. The bread is quite rough which rub the skin off the roof of my mouth. Furthermore, the salad was super sour (which I was not told that It was going to be a sour salad).   I would definitely come back for the coffee though!

jAd_EbJNdSSOGu_Nzt3vhw.review_text: We went here for a quick bite/coffee before our trip down to LA in the morning.  We had a restaurant.com voucher, and I ordered an oatmeal with fresh fruit (extra charge) and a latte. The oatmeal was nothing too special, but the latte was pretty good.  I always love the unique coffee taste of an independent shop versus the mass produced Starbucks coffee taste.   The service was pretty quick with the food and drinks.  The place seemed like a chill environment to study, lounge and talk with friends.   I would probably go back again if lived in the San Fran area.

zqUtgpnDjAorTI--t-dvFg.review_text: Beautiful ambiance, great staff, and nice music.  I love this cafe so much, I'm thinking about moving to this neighborhood...just to frequent this cafe.  The people that work here greet you with a smile, take your order, and then leave you alone.  Great place to study and get work done.   Other reasons that earned Cafe Capriccio 5 stars : + free wi-fi with a strong signal + clean interior + outside seating + ample plugs for your laptop (inside) + wine and beer selection + clean bathroom  I didn't eat anything (though the selection is diverse and looks amazing), but I did have the best soy hot chocolate ever.  I strongly recommend this cafe.   If you come, maybe I'll see you there!!  Ciao!

04BUrqUE7Rq9Y5-0mKOGTg.review_text: All you could possibly ask for from a neighborhood cafe: * A simple and delicious menu * Ample selection of tables, benches, couches, stools and even outdoor seating * Free wi-fi with accessible plugs * Coffee that does not taste like like a franchise * And my favorite, a wine selection for when you've had enough caffeine or your looking to wind down (not up) with a good read  That last point bumped this place up from 4 to 5 stars in my book.  I plan to make myself a regular here.

ObTnNcCumzZdNpa22EwwYQ.review_text: Could be five stars but I think usually grade low.   My outmeal with fruit breakfast was almost perfect.

v3ial-ln4kh1RgM7BQxXoA.review_text: This is probably my favorite cafe in North Beach. The owners are cool, the wifi is fast - none of that silly zrnet shit, just plain wifi... I work from here pretty often, the place has got a lot more popular with tourists, which kindda turns me off a bit, so I try to avoid it in the breakfast hours now...  Their food is good too, I like the food at Sappore better, but the wifi sucks there. The coffee is decent, you can't expect quality like Ritual or Vivace or Blue Bottle around here, so I'm not overly picky. I care more about the speed and reliability of their wifi than anything else...

wKq30kYS60VvsCFxNH46Cw.review_text: The guy at the register wasn't very friendly but the cap I ordered made by the guy in the back was great! Like that it wasn't surrounded by so many tourists but probably wouldn't come back unless I had nowhere else to go

-0pCM1096pukXVsPb7YDLg.review_text: Everything a cafe should be:    -  A+ atmosphere -  A+ coffee -  A+ food, pastries, and snacks -  Spacious outdoor seating -  Free wi-fi -  A staff who care about the place & are friendly -  Good hours  Can't ask for much more.

3Ru1OiTWBmujn9VmM7iNBw.review_text: great food.  one off the best cappuccino  I've found in sf.

ptfsHN5G68OpIceLCoq0Iw.review_text: Amazingly good fresh ground mocha. Great place to hang out, do some work, and just enjoy the sunny side of the city :)

hKU1fWULSln8WYj8hV2E9g.review_text: North beach cafe at its finest

VkD9M-iw58_ld7pbBWoqeQ.review_text: Cafe Capriccio is an enjoyable neighborhood cafe that is within walking distance to both Fisherman's Wharf and Little Italy.  The food is fresh, well prepared, and reasonably priced.  In particular the Caprese Salad and pies are delicious.  You won't be wowed as it is not avant-garde or exceptional food, but you won't feel as if you've had a bad meal.  They occasionally run out of items towards the end of the day as they seems to have a substantial morning rush of tourists.  The service is friendly and efficient.  If you're in the area, I recommend that you stop by and enjoy your espresso as an array of tourists and locals go about their day.

spMHR0xUIJqhDTRsczMmlg.review_text: My wife and I happened to stumble upon this place while wondering around San Francisco and decided to check it out. It is a nice, comfortable place with indoor/outdoor seating and a very friendly staff. I had the tomato sandwich which contained tomato, red onion, cream cheese and capers on a bagel, and although it sounded a little weird at first it was absolutely delicious. I am not much of a coffee drinker but I did decide to get an iced mocha while I was there which was also very good. Would highly recommend it for breakfast or just to kill some time

uMlX0xIG4pgp2xIQlY9PlQ.review_text: had a delicious mocha here the other Saturday.... barely sweet, rich chocolate taste, no whip cream offered (bonus) and a great ambiance with ample people watching at street side cafe tables. Outdoor seating is dog friendly (another bonus).

Dhq1fZBc3m3EL9pIre297g.review_text: The bf had an early morning meeting at The Cannery so I volunteered to drive him. He insisted on leaving super early and as a result we arrived at 7am for an 8am meeting.   In desperate need of some caffeine (he woke me up at 5am to drive from Santa Cruz!) I did a quick yelp search for cafe's in the area and landed on cafe capriccio.   We entered around 7:15 which was right after they open and I was surprised to already see people inside, good sign.   The bf ordered a chocolate croissant with a mocha and I ordered the breakfast parfait with a plain ol' coffee. These 4 items totaled around $15.   The guy working seemed more interested in chatting with his coworker than he did interacting with us. He didn't greet us when we walked in, despite looking right at us and hearing me greet him. His disinterest became apparent when he forgot about my coffee and was quite rude when my bf reminded him. It's a shame because the other two guys working there seemed pleasant.   Anyway, the coffee was fine, the parfait was fine (store bought yogurt and granola) and the bf said that his croissant tasted remarkably like the frozen ones you buy at trader joes.   Meh. More like 2.5 but rounding to 3.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Coffee shop perfection.  Quintessential San Francisco location. A charming interior, plenty of seating, abundance outlets and free wifi. It was just a bit too cold to sit outside, which made the open window looking out onto the mason/chestnut scene all the more perfect.  Fantastic food. My parfait was loaded with bananas, strawberries, nonfat yogurt and granola (perfect), my latte was nonfat with sugar free vanilla syrup (perfect), and my sandwich needed no customization - chicken, hummus, tomatoes, just how I'd make it (perfect). It came with an unexpected salad - nice touch, and good to know in case you're like me and would have asked for no dressing.  Top notch service. Friendly, attentive, relaxed. In other words, perfect.

bq_KRX__zL4WGJWQKEwE5g.review_text: Most reviewers (it seems) love this place for the coffee. We didn't have any, but, if we were to return, that is all that we would get, as the food was disappointing.  We stopped by for lunch on our way out of the city and ordered a pear, gorgonzola salad with chicken and a caprese panini as well as iced tea, a strawberry italian soda, and a water. The iced tea was freshly brewed, the italian soda tasted like soda water, and our water never arrived. When the food came out to the table, there was no chicken on the salad. We mentioned this to the gentleman who brought it. He disagreed before reluctantly taking the salad back to add chicken. It actually wasn't a bad dish, but the dressing was uneven - heavy in some bits, light in others. It was more the attitude of the server that bothered us. In terms of the sandwich, it was ok. Nothing unique or delicious.  I think Yelp best sums up our experience here with a, "Meh. I've experieneced better."

At-RIEC3zPuUO5W_R7f27A.review_text: This place used to be mediocre at best but is now very good under the new ownership. Shame on anyone who goes to the Starbucks around the corner!

MB0quDwn_WbmTt_pAknfTg.review_text: I met a friend here for lunch on Wednesday.  The outside seating looked very inviting and the menu looked even better.    I had the proscuitto and salame panino and my friend had the roast beef panino.  My sandwich was delicious:  thick proscuitto, yummy salame, mouth-watering fresh mozzarella, red pepper, lettuce, and tomato were on the sandwich.  There was no trace of the portabella mushroom that is listed on the menu, but the sandwich was still good without it.  My friend enjoyed his panino as well.  Less than a week after opening, they're still working out the kinks on the service side (which is to be expected).  Things moved slowly, but we were treated to a piece of cake on the house at the end of our meal.  All in all, a good place to dine outside and enjoy a sunny day.

JoxKFDq_uQ6khm8lG6H4zw.review_text: We wanted to find something for breakfast not too far from Fisherman's Wharf, but also wasn't too touristy or crowded.  Cafe Capriccio had a nice neighborhood/local feel with decent prices. The bagels were fresh, the yogurt parfait had a generous amount of fruit, and the latte was prepared well.

Sx2WNZhGIJNSbcBXPhEWng.review_text: Delicious Panini, salad, and soup! Fresh and tasty!

NtrF02e7zPm_LsQizEbyxA.review_text: I think I had one of the best mochas I've ever had at this cafe! I also got the egg wrap which was very good and not too small. My wife got the parfait which she really liked and a hazelnut coffee that she said was delicious. Overall I liked this place a lot!

WOlfaz4vzUNvNxCScXeYrg.review_text: Cute cafe.  I always grab a coffee and breakfast here before business meetings.  It's a really neighborhood-y spot where everyone knows the people working behind the counter.  I haven't been there for lunch or wine but I will definitely pop in there sometime soon.

lOnqJeopWcH7CHEUbartEQ.review_text: Came here for breakfast. The ham and cheese croissant was tasty. The latte was yummy and artfully done. :)

jUtaYycgNE1XCdUO2RS6ug.review_text: We found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out since we were on the way to Pier 33 for Alcatraz.  Not much to choose from the menu when it comes to breakfast.  I ordered a coffee and breakfast wrap with egg, cheddar cheese and ham.  The coffee was alright.  No big deal.  The wrap was healthy and delicious.  My husband ordered the roast beef panini.  I only took one bite because it was too greasy.  We sat outside to have breaksfast since San Francisco has had amazing weather.  It was probably 60 degrees.  Not one cloud in the sky.  Perfect breakfast weather.  Not much for scenery.  Good to grab something fast on the go.

OQImub6evGiBTwpQmoVUjA.review_text: --Update:  The owners fight with each other behind the counter.  It's soured me on the whole place.  And I hear they're not nice to their employees.  What a shame.  --Original review: It really does take AGES to open a new eatery in North Beach, and now that Lisa and Tarek have navigated the treacherous shoals of the Tel-Hi Dwellers, North Beach Association, and the other myriad agencies, groups, and other interested parties, we can all be glad that they have FINALLY opened their doors.  Anyone who lives in the neighborhood has surely walked by the bright red facade of the former flower shop and wondered: When the hell are these people going to open up?!?  Friday, April 27 was their first official, full day of business.  They opened their doors for a few hours on Thursday to give an unannounced preview to friends and neighbors.  Here are my initial impressions: - Lisa and Tarek are both really lovely, friendly, and welcoming people.  As long as they're in the house, I anticipate a great vibe.  They have worked to be a neighborhood-friendly establishment and plan to host neighborhood events and generally turn their place into our second living room.   - The menu looks great!  I haven't sampled anything yet, but I'm delighted to see oatmeal as an option for breakfast (anything other than fat-laden pastries, please!), plus a caprese sandwich - a personal favorite.  It's a lengthy menu for a place of its size, so I'm looking forward to trying out the selection.  And the prices looked pretty reasonable. - Free Wireless.  There's a pay-to-surf station inside, but if you bring your laptop with wireless card, there's free wireless access from the cafe. - Beautiful south-west orientation for sidewalk seating!  The chairs are comfy and they've done a nice job with the flower boxes.  I predict that you will find me here many an afternoon.  Lisa tells me they'll be open 7 AM to 9 PM, so they'll have a great chance to capture late afternoon and evening business that earlier-closing cafes skip. - They have Ace apple cider.  Bonus point.  I'll be back to post more once I've had a chance to visit a few more times and try out some of the menu.  For now, it was just a delight to sit at the sidewalk table and drink a free beer and chat with Lisa.

zj3FG24HjTjmf8k60EUr4Q.review_text: A very nice cafe to visit on the weekend. Cafe Capriccio is a good place to chat with a friend or get work done from your laptop.  It's a bit out of the way and there is only street parking, which is a bit hard to find in the North Beach neighborhood. The hours are short; the 6pm closing time means I can only come out here on the weekends instead of after work during the week.   But it's a nice place. Not very large but seating isn't hard to find. A bit noisy from the refrigeration, but the music they play in the background is light and not obnoxious. There are plenty of outlets for laptops and the wifi is reliable.  All in all, I've never regretted a visit to Cafe Capriccio. It's a trek well worth it.

mOnYWi_51_RfEuDhAW0ddw.review_text: Capriccio is a nice cafe to grab a latte or breakfast.  Their salmon bagel is pricey, but pretty good.  Their salads are ok.  I'm a fan of their drinks.  A good change of pace from Starbucks.

qKIUs9G1VhgJ1wPPbFK1sQ.review_text: Came here to kill time while doing laundry across the street. Great cappuccinos, pillows, PW-free WiFi. Good alternative to a Starbucks. Oh and I saw they have wine too.

bksi9AKVbg9bsgNqAJhO6g.review_text: Ive been here over 4 times now and each time Ive had to wait FOREVER. I realize this is norths beach and tourist central but the other cafes around this area dont seem to go through this same problem. Today I waited to see customers after me getting served (they had simple orders, I had a cappuccino) and finally after i got my cappuccino, it was pretty bad quality. I really liked their lattes here, so thats why i keep coming back, but its not worth it anymore.

gPoMPlgeXmHWZS8ny6dW2g.review_text: This is a real neighborhood establishment. Everyone who works here is extremely friendly and they know most every customer by name.   The cappuccinos are a dream and they only use Intelligentsia beans (very high quality).  Expect a little heart or rosetta in the foam. Yum. They're coffee is all french press, meaning it made fresh constantly. There is no decaf (because decaf is for suckers) but they do carry Mighty Leaf herbal teas.   They have a variety of croissants, including chocolate and almond. I wish they would get them from a better, local purveyor. They're fine but not exceptional like the ones you might get at Four Barrel or local North Beach bakeries.  The food is quite good for cafe-style fare. The sandwiches are hearty and the various entree-sized salads are tasty. You can get basic breakfast foods until 11am, such as bagels, egg wraps and parfaits.  They offer quiche with salad all day (or until they run out). The portions are great.  As of spring 2013 they started a weekend wine-tasting program Thurs-Sun in the evenings. Once they get some better storage for the wine and some higher-end producers, I can really see this taking off. For now it's just an excuse for the locals to grab a glass, sit outside and enjoy the evening.   Capriccio could make little improvements here and there, but on the whole it is a great little neighborhood cafe with nice people, great coffee and tasty food. I highly suggest stopping in to grab a coffee and chat or to grab a table and partake of the free wi-fi.

Ldy03uMFaEEEnh3KIsPP_w.review_text: So I have only gone in there for some coffee drinks, but I have to say that this is my favorite coffee shop in the city so far because of how polite, nice, and fast they are.  I have recently gone to some places where you wait 10 minutes for one latte, with rude service, and only one other person in line. Every time I get my coffee drinks here the lovely blonde woman and the guy making the drinks are very professional and polite.  Not to mention my latte is always delicious and has such a pretty swirly pattern on the foam.  I also like the decor and the comfortable seating arrangements inside.  I wish this place was in my neighborhood!  Update:  Had some delicious cupcakes here after this review.  yum!

xz8zl7Xpo9WS8XitIWTpPw.review_text: Wow, the warf/north beach actually has civilization.  For this 12 year SF resident, this place is just right.  Macchiato, yes.

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: I used to come here at least once a week when I lived in North Beach.  The guy who works there (maybe he's the owner?) is superduper nice.  They have indoor and outdoor seating.  They serve everything from pastry to coffee to beer and wine.  When I go here, I usually get a chicken panini with roasted veggies and hummus.  It comes with a side salad. What I love about this cafe is that they offer free Wifi.  What I don't like about this cafe are the flies inside the cafe that land on your food.  Without the flies I would give this spot 4 stars.

8vsTU9y4vVs3GjmjPp2AUQ.review_text: I was surprised. Nowadays, any jerk on the street can open a coffee house. Usually, they: -look awful and make lousy coffee. or... -look great and make shitty coffee.  So going into Capriccio, my expectations were in check. At a glance the place looked great so I'm thinkin' "heeeerrreeee we go." To my surprise, my unassuming paper cup was exceedingly decent. Huh. So I learned my lesson.  This could be a good place to sit and uh drink coffee. You know, there are coffee places that you can't wait to ditch, this is not one of one. In fact if I wasn't on my way out, I would have enjoyed sticking around. It was busy enough to suggest the coffee is a decent staple of the neighborhood, but not so busy that you have to do the whole circling buzzard routine like at Ritual.  So that's that. Not bad at all. One time that expecting less really did yield a positive return. Huh, who knew?

NcwQ9tKFCtpZi2B8OEB_yg.review_text: I love Cafe Capriccio's mochas. Probably never have a better one in my life. I also enjoy their chicken ceaser wrap. Delicious! I try not to go too many days without getting a treat at this wonderful north beach cafe.

Vh_0zlQ0fcZO1iSghObCWg.review_text: Definitely one of the better cafes in the area. Nice food, nice outdoor and indoor seating, nice servers.  I planned to get an almond croissant, but the guy in front of me bought the last one, so that was sad. I asked and they said that they wouldn't be making any more that day. Sad again, especially given that it was only noon.   But I got the granola and it was nice - my friend got a sandwich and also thought it was pretty good. The coffees not only tasted good, but were presented nicely as well.

p2RNQlGqImPe8DnuSVOVVw.review_text: i could live there!!!! not even kidding! best coffee in town.

ZWnv69H5I-860VgvjEUvcQ.review_text: Neighbourhood gem. Real good coffee. The tomato/cheese bagel I had was very delicious, well balanced with salty capers and sweet red onions. Internet worked very well. Friendly & fast service, pleasant interior and exterior. I am hooked up.

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: Stopped by the cafe on Sunday morning and had one of the best soy cappuccinos I've ever had (although I usually get my coffee black, weird).  I felt like this adorable cafe probably made amazing drinks and I was NOT disappointed (although ordered with an extra shot of espresso..so I may have been caffeine drunk..).  I got the yogurt parfait to eat and the granola was crunchy and there were BANANAS!!!! I hate places that give you all the fruit no one wants (melons I'm looking at you).   I can't wait to come back for lunch since the paninis & sandwiches looked delish! The guys who were working were extremely friendly and would be a welcome inclusion to my weekend routine :)

7CWRoP0f4TLwRkYR5syiqQ.review_text: I came here for lunch and it's a cute little cafe. Very tiny, actually. Not sure if I would come here to do work since there is not much space. But for the purpose of sitting down with a friend to chat over a cup of coffee/tea Cafe Capriccio is perfect.

qU3E7ENm8VsMc_IZCpTCZA.review_text: I've only come to get something to go, so can't comment about the table service. Though it does seem like a nice place to have a leisurely meal or coffee. Whoever helped me, whether it was the owner or staff I don't know, seemed nice enough and happy with their job.  The food is ok. The coffee is kind of bleh. It's weak and the plastic lids have a funky smell to them. Not a rotten smell or anything, but you just get the feeling that they've been sitting around for a little too long.

odM7WqRsORcMsFymWEMiAw.review_text: So far, I've only had 1 item from this place (the Caprese Panini), but it was very good: tasty & well-presented.  Nice room, too: clean, well-appointed, with outdoor seating as well.  Staff was friendly & overall vibe was pleasant.  I work in Fisherman's Wharf, and I am continually challenged by the lack of decent Lunch places there.  Considering that, Capriccio is a particularly good find.  I will definitely be going back...

kv_coFfYsJ3oAxZu0pIXkg.review_text: Finally - the coffee is good, the new owners are friendly, the space looks better and I will start going back to this cute little corner coffee shop in my neighborhood.  The latte I ordered today was only $2.71 and was outstanding.  So happy with the ownership change and the improvements!  I look forward to seeing them grow and improve even more.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: Cute, quiet coffee shop -- great for getting some work done, or for grabbing a book and relaxing.  Located in a cute residential neighborhood, and also has some outdoor seating.

PgrCdD3iPgYzXxO8QsMnew.review_text: Fantastic!  Wandering around too early on Sunday morning and looking for somewhere to rest, we saw this cafe and popped in for a latte and chocolate croissant.    Cozy, neighborhood shop with tables out front to enjoy your beverage and pastry.  Perfectly charming!

C-zzygTmQhZFA1K5qHND5w.review_text: Met with a co-worker at Cafe Capriccio for coffee and breakfast one morning.  Overall,  this place is a really great local coffee shop and I'll be going back.  I ordered a cafe au lait, which was incredible.  I also had an egg white omelette which was pretty good.  The cafe seemed like it had a lot of locals, and it would be an perfect place to study or read a book.

pKbaS8S9V4nL-p3WCA3rtg.review_text: This morning - 1/12/2012 - honestly got the worst coffee ever - excellent choc croissant though.  Had to stop by a Starbucks to get a proper cup of joe and throw away my $2 cup from this Cafe...that bad!

pHwlLUKTfB2kzBPRV0N4Ng.review_text: Stopped in for a latte. Very good coffee. Seemed like a great place to spend some time relaxing

eBm6v1wUQgrdOJ6DJTfKoQ.review_text: Went here for lunch with two coworkers (even though I'd packed a salad) and I was utterly, totally disappointed. The cafe has a cute exterior, but don't be fooled! The baristas (male baristas = barristers?) were distant and unhelpful. Tea was weak -- I ordered a small and received a cup much larger than the 6-ounce mug I was expecting. My panini was grotty: the bread was crisp, but the fillings were tepid (as though the sandwich hadn't been heated long enough?) and the tomatoes were mealy. Chicken cubes tasted as though they'd been prepared days earlier. Adding insult to injury was the fact that I shelled out $12 for the watery tea and sandwich-mess. Oh, if only I'd stuck with my salad...

pOl7HauDeEkcQLZWDbgg6Q.review_text: What a delighful place with delicious food and charming proprietors!  While I'm emabarrassed to say that I am a picky eater, it's not a problem here. They are inventful with their meals and menu, as well as flexible on the fly. They are kind enough to adjust their offerings to suit my tastes and dietary needs.   I love them and they're right by my office, so it's great for morning meetings and lunch work sessions.   They make life in North Beach civilized. Oh, and they have free WiFi. How cool is THAT!

63magicb7zDNIC_fIwfffA.review_text: I love Cafe Capriccio. It is an adorable little coffee shop that's a bit hidden when compared to all of the coffee shops on Columbus. The seats are comfy, decorated with pillows and magazines are provided to read. This place is a great place to spend a morning sipping on an artsy cappuccino (they put little hearts and pictures in the foam) and eating a granola mixture with milk and fresh cut up strawberries and bananas. Yummmy! They also have sandwiches for lunch but I've never tried them.  For the food and service, this place definitely gets 5 stars. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because there have been a few times when I needed to get food to go because it was completely packed and because it could be a bit more lit.....But then I might spend hours studying there and they may never get rid of me.   This place is highly recommended. Oh, and did I mention there's free wifi? A gem!

iFGNCGcMu2iZYesalnbOtw.review_text: Cafe Capriccio has an absolutely lovely ambiance with genuinely nice owners who care about their customers (they work the counter and see to your every need), scrumptious paninos (freshest bread and perfect fillings), lots of vegetarian menu options and strong coffee. Oh -- and FREE WIFI. Does it get any better? I just moved to the area and plan to be here a lot.

sQT4VOZUwpDqcnrPFibJfw.review_text: clean, quiet, free wifi, yummy coffee, a friendly staff that leaves you alone, the occasional dog that visits - what more could you ask for in a neighborhood joint?  ask for their frequent buyer card.

7sKBX_P0LXeLXJGc2JDYSg.review_text: These guys truly make the best coffee in Nth Beach, possibly even the city! Fellow Aussies: their cappuccino is a perfect 'flat white'.  One teeny weeny gripe, certain staff members can sometimes be less than friendly, and their ordering system (whereby the poor barista often has to do everything) needs work.

pPi_DHfkWETrMClkrQ_G9A.review_text: They say, Home is where the Heart is. Well it's more like Home is where the Capprichio is.   Around the corner from it's competitors, Capriccio is that hidden treasure in North Beach that brightens your day at any time between 6-7pm Monday-Sunday. Can't help you after hours, sorry that's when you call a therapist for your problems.  A crew of multi-ethnic, multi faceted peeps that run the show, always chill and always upbeat. Out door seating if you wanna kick in some vitamin D on a sunny day, out door seating if u cant afford a shower on a rainy day. Excellent for studying, or reading, with the assistance of free wifi.  I've been a regular at this cafe for about 2 years for my cup a joe, but it's there Lattes that bring the real shine. I've been so addicted that my cards have been stamped up over and over. 10 star stamps and I'm ordering a FREE large latte with 9 shots pimpskillet, like fiddy cent would!

KnMwl1G5lrIU1N5Bty-rlg.review_text: The food is tasty, but the wait is way too long, long line-ups in the morning, because they have one cook and they always mess up orders, give wrong change..  I came here a couple of times and each time they'd forget something from my order. Once they forgot about my large latte I ordered and when I reminded them they made me small first, then medium and then finally made my large one.  They have a hotel almost next door and the crowd is flowing from there most of the time. Mornings are the worst to come, you'll grow old and die waiting.

AtoDIsk5vEcIIXJqPp-PLQ.review_text: Small shop, outside seating, free wifi, but really unreliable signal.  Nice service, good food, and good coffee.

c_UiCt7xOZbpZrIrsrUB7g.review_text: By far the best coffee in the area. Staff are super sweet. Their sandwhiches are good too. Well done !

H3PFTHE-SL1gg2exnNy1jg.review_text: What a cute little place in North Beach. The interior was so inviting and the Batistas were really friendly. They even offered to bring our coffees to us outside. We ordered a mocha and a cappuccino and while the mocha was really good, the cappuccino was a little over-extracted. Oh well, the ambiance made up for it :)

aIqtnxoopMTWARZNCqlY1w.review_text: Alrighty, I'm a total fan. I can't give them 5 stars with the knowledge that their breakfasty sandwiches are so average, but everything else is stellar.   Their chai tea rivals the Boulange as the best in the city, the pastries are solid and the people that work there are cool and friendly. A bunch of people come and hang out with their laptops or a book and sit in the sun at the tables outside when it's nice. Seating inside is a little limited though.   One of my favorites in the NB!

WH4mAkt2q3exGDyQf_EZ1Q.review_text: It was ok.  I got my coffee and bagel with less-than-great hummus and managed to eat it.  The lady called me "sweetie" at least ten times and "honey bun" once in a tone of not-so-restrained annoyance.  Not a pleasant experience and not great-tasting either.

-fArTy74H8r8a0goRzpNbA.review_text: Look, there is nothing special here. Well, perhaps they do breakfast better than lunch?  I had lunch here with 6 others.  The employees were nice and efficient, but the place looked a little dumpy, and the food was just okay.  I didn't finish my panini or soup. Certainly not what I expect at 4 star level.

_OCVA417JevjE1ifcftgIA.review_text: I love this cafe. It's really cute the service is great! I always get the lattes and chicken or beef panini. This is a good spot if you need some time to study or read a book. They have free wifi and a couple of outlets for your laptop. There's an outdoor seating, so it's also a nice place to have coffee with some friends.

jCPCn1wzUDktPxVV2ye6BQ.review_text: Great cafe for breakfast bagel sandwiches. I'm not sure about the coffee since i don't drink the stuff, although other people seem to enjoy it. I would definitely return for another bagel sandwich.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: This place is awesome.  The coffee here is amazing.  Better than that blue bottle crap.  Don't come here so I can find a table to write my fatty yelp reviews.

EGBVfQeXjkoY9aMBXp-S8w.review_text: Love this place. Great Chai Latte, best I've tried in the city. Great cupcakes too.

mATkJ62zp1Iobu8wxHmfeA.review_text: Place isn't bad but not the 4.5 stars it's getting. Starting to feel the taste standards in sf are pretty low.  Saw this place on yelp and figured it was within walking distance and got good reviews.  I ordered the chicken panini and the lady friend got some sort of quiche.  Mine was all bread & hummus without much flavor.  Hers was decent but bland.  Didn't seem to be any seasoning and all you could taste were the black olives.  Strange.  I guess this is more of a place for bread and yogurt, and such.  Don't know.  Baffled.  Keep in mind that all of this needs to be taken with a grain of salt as I'm not a big cafe person, which is why it was strange that I'm here in sf.  This place has more cafes than Wisconsin has bars.

IzWPwr6Hm5qNhrMPcqKlSw.review_text: This place is just the spot to go to if your looking for a pleasant environment and great coffee especially the mochas. I also liked the sandwich very fresh and free wifi :)

3CcR8pm-lilG_qW1WhjxHw.review_text: I absolutely loved this place. The manager and staff were by far some of the nicest, most down to earth individuals. The food (Best panini I've had), to say the least, was wonderful and the cafe  was very well kept.The whole environment there was perfect. I definitely will be coming back.

kAf3fe3Z4T43DYys8j1jaA.review_text: A nice place for locals.  The coffee and service are both pretty good; the food is decent.

ele8GHyshSdYpClRbziJVQ.review_text: We came here every morning for 5 days as we were staying across the street at the lovely San Remo Hotel. The food was always delicious.  I especially enjoyed the Breakfast Parfait with yogurt, granola and fresh fruit. The fruit varied each time and was always very fresh and tasty.  The drip coffee was fine and I was told by my fiend that the espresso was fantastic.  The staff was always very friendly.   The best part was the free wireless.  Perfect for traveling with a laptop.  I would definitely come here again if in the neighborhood.

Wflw5pjgoV3nr7t1MSgy2w.review_text: free wifi, good sized tables, EXCELLENT espresso, not crazy crowded, and really delicious pear gorgonzola honey salad.

S2abQwduBzRpEbF_ChBkyQ.review_text: i had a restaurant.com voucher here and ordered the smoked salmon bagel & a chai latte. the smoked salmon had a bit too much cream cheese on it and the salmon slices were thin; the latte was lacking the chai flavor. food was acceptable, but not impressive.

pqFV6gicp9vMSsxBFlu40g.review_text: Sorry to have to say that my pear salad was drenched in salad dressing which made it very difficult to enjoy, and my turkey sandwich was mostly bread with two petty slices of turkey and two petty slices of avocado.  I guess I really just don't expect to be served food like this.

GM_eP6oJUX2U3iqlpkCpHQ.review_text: Great environment, friendly staff good service.   The pizza is GREAT, can't go wrong with the calamari, the coffee is good but nothing out of the ordinary.   Just noticed they are now on OrderAhead, so you can order on your iPhone for pick up and skip the breakfast line - BIG plus.

HceZs_rhc-SJTwlQ52n9JQ.review_text: Probably one of my favorite places to casually eat in SF. My BF lives down the street so it's the first place we think of when we want a bite - morning or afternoon. The hospitality is unbeatable and the food is incredibly fresh and light. You don't feel like you need to walk around the block a few times after eating there.

hHe9rtIBNwVByKYQhrjJmg.review_text: What I like: -great outside seating -yummy coffee (love it!) -nice guy behind the counter -great roast beef sandwich  What I don't like: -their chai tea. It's the weirdest thing I've ever had. Not at all what you would expect.  -big screen TV on the wall. It feels tacky and is annoying. -slightly slow service  What I do: I choose coffee over chi and sit outside to avoid the TV. Perfect.

OvR19daYCBiL4FnZOQzQsA.review_text: Cafe Capriccio was your ideal french cozy cafe'. Its a corner shop in the middle of a nostalgic San Fran neighborhood.   Small tables held up the walls with the coffee bar dominating the room. INstead of the traditioning cakes and pastries, the staff had a selection of quiche in the cooler. I chose the Mexican flavor as my wife chose the Pesto. Both were delicious. Further, the coffee was life changing.   Maybe it was the gloomy weather or the neighborhood patrons coming in and out; either way it was perfect.   We will be back.

h3V10dN21mI06bgcXfuBlg.review_text: Great place. Owners are awesome, coffee is really top notch.

sZ1QAMEj5zjJq92dhurtug.review_text: My fav. cafe.  Free wifi, nice people, and a cute interior, where I can sit as long as I like.  The parfait and the caprese sandwich are fabulous everytime!  They keep things simple, and stick with what works.

UdJavnO3AEOFvzIED1cCzA.review_text: I happily spent an entire afternoon here working away.  Complete with a friendly vibe, good background music, and tasty iced lattes keeping me energized.

mlVAa-IySCq1FGLYG2ysqg.review_text: I think I have to give this place another star... it's just that good.   I introduced this hidden gem to one of my good friends and together we came here to work on final projects for school several times. We both fell in love with this place more and more with each visit. The coffee is so amazing! Now, even if I don't stop in to do work, I will stop by just to get a coffee to go... it adds a little bit of sunshine to any type of day that I may be having.   Definitely recommend the yogurt parfait, the oatmeal, americano, regular coffee or the cafe au lait. So good!

gi3VkcISbUpd0BQ68FerAQ.review_text: Spectacular coffee, friendly staff and very good bagels... yes quality bagels in SF!  That alone is reason to go.  But seriously, the coffee rivals everything from Blue Bottle to Ritual.  I think  they use Illy and big props to the Barista - he knows how to make great espresso and lattes.  PLUS he doesn't come across as too cool for school.

Xd_2uetx9LxA2hQassydJA.review_text: My favorite cafe in the city, and I think I have been to quite a few.  It is not easy to find good cappuccino in the States -- ask anyone from Continental Europe, let alone Italy. This makes Cafe Cappriccio particularly special. I am talking about coffee, instead of indifferent froth thing with some liquid at the bottom.  This place is also good for breakfast/ lunch. The selection is narrow, but everything they make, they make it good.  The place attracts a number of regulars from the neighborhood, myself included, which I think speaks to its quality. I have seen one bad review, which apparently received a angry private message in response. The original reviewer assumes that this was written by the staff or the owner. However, I can surely say that this place has many loyalists and I would not find it surprising if it was one of us. (Nevertheless, everyone's entitled to their own opinion -- people can read and judge for themselves).  Other features: Great for studying/ working, many power outlets, free and fast wi-fi, quiet, cozy, friendly staff, fast with orders. Too crowded only around lunchtime. However, a bit on the expensive side. Definitely recommended.

USGwU83FRXkHT_cB6ucIqw.review_text: First of all if you want me to return, you should be friendly!! The girl who helped me was so rude! I had a restaurant.com certificate and she looked at it like it was in another language! I asked about something on the menu and she said rudely, I don't know what your talking about. I ordered a mimosa and then said we don't have those. I ordered a chai latte which tasted good but not hot enough. I also ordered a egg wrap which was just okay. Needless to say I probably won't be using my other certificate I bought for here. Very disappointing experience :(

ujHwkKknvFGh7UnJsVn1mg.review_text: Coffee here is quite good, one of the places I like in the area.  There's another cafe around that serves better coffee, but they don't open until 8:30.  If I need a coffee early in the morning, I would come here before work.  Cool staffs.

5hpstpoaZrOFOOQhIzqL4A.review_text: Why is this place not in Denver?!!?  This is exactly what I am looking for every time I go into another cafe.  Quaint, quiet, wonderful smells, incredibly helpful staff, good food options and the feeling that coffee is to be enjoyed, not slammed in a rush to get your caffeine drip started.  I had a very simple hazelnut latte and the thing just blew me away.  It must have been the quality of the beans, but they were not joking around.  The mug was so big and warm and colorful and they spent the time to make an artistic design in my foam, which is one of my all time favorite things.  In my personal opinion, it is the difference between a place to get coffee, and a cafe.  Way to go staff of Capriccio.  In terms of food, I had the fresh fruit with granola, and it was just that- very fresh fruit with amazing granola.    If I am back in San Fran anytime soon, it wouldn't be soon enough to get here again.

Ka3sTG2hnVP696O72HiJlg.review_text: Cappuccino was very good, and the prosciutto panini was excellent. Very fresh Buffalo mozzarella.  I plan on going back here!

zEEMKVoTrBhomd-8bvbTjw.review_text: First things first - the coffee here is insanely good.  The quality of the espresso has just been cranked up a few notches recently from an already lofty post.  The first few sips especially are creamy coffee heaven.  These guys take their coffee seriously and it shows.  As if that weren't enough, the food is also very tasty with lots of good baked goods and breakfast fare and then an excellent cafe menu of salads, wraps, panini, etc.  And it just keep getting better.  The staff is super friendly and cool, the location is off the beaten path and gets lots of sun on the outside seating.  The inside is cozy on colder/rainier days too.  If you are in the 'hood check it out.  Or even make the special trip - you can hit Trader Joe's nearby on the way home.  Cafe Capriccio is awesome.

SxlJ59sR8frvcCQrT8ZOfQ.review_text: I came here to study after reading the reviews on Yelp and was not disappointed. There are many tables and wall outlets for laptops. The booths against the wall were very comfortable. It was not noisy. Staff was courteous and the all of the food and the coffee were delicious. The only complaint I have is that the prices are a bit steep. Ordering coffee and food came out to about $12.50 per person.

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: This is a great spot when walking around town with the bf and feeling the need to stop in for a short snack because he forgot to get something to munch on earlier.  Ladies, beware of the man that becomes Grendel on an empty stomach.  Small, cozy, and unpretentious, this is a spot for locals to meander in and grab their cup of liquid caffeine prior to heading out for the daily morning walk.  I requested my usual caffe latte and it came out exceptionally strong.  Not too roomy but for the mid-morning, a good spot on the go.  They also carried pastries but I did not purchase anything as we were to have lunch in North Beach.  Next time, that bran muffin would be mine.

BI_PXSF5M61S8O9bqR7VVA.review_text: Such a cute cafe with tons of food of all kinds to choose from. Sandwiches are yummy! They also serve alcohol, which is always a plus : )  It gets busy quick and service is somewhat slow.

Sfgfz2Awh2EGPJvoEwwhKQ.review_text: Use the Yelp check-in discount and enjoy the neighborhood ambience, coffee smells and the warm friendly service. I am an out- of-towner yet have started my last three mornings here.

aD_nDmBiRLg9yLzX2dF_8w.review_text: Great neighborhood corner cafe!  I really liked the laid back and friendly atmosphere, the coffee was bold, and my prosciutto panini was super flavorful and delicious.  I especially loved the bread...a local, artisan-made Italian roll.  Everything appeared/tasted fresh and quality.

B9_M5qoWA5tHXQWHfoW0tg.review_text: Cute little coffe shop in North Beach. I like how the place is setup inside and outside. Definitely a great place to hangout with friends or by yourself. Service is very attentive and friendly. Highly recommend it.

sH_t9HCv3hIxVagul3J3gQ.review_text: Wanted to try a new coffee shop, and the proximity of this place brought me in.  You can tell its a local favorite, we saw a long line of people form behind us just after we came in and it didn't really subside while we were in here.  The espresso drinks we had were really good, definitely get my recommendation on those.  I like the vibe of the place, really homey and mellow.  I wanted to also get a bit to eat, and the quiche looked awesome.  But $7.XX for a slice??  Seems mighty steep, I don't care how good this could have been.  But, maybe some day.

TbotEm1b25Wi-kFnVGEHWw.review_text: I was in search of a wifi connection one afternoon when I stumbled upon this place.  And while their internet service wasn't available, I may have enjoyed one of the best mochas I've ever had.  Since it was the afternoon, things were quiet but the girl that was there working was very nice.

4gqCSi1VxP3Rz7JEN2mmTQ.review_text: Everything you could want in a local cafe.  Surprisingly good food.  I had turkey on ciabatta, which was awesome.  My friend had mushroom quiche, which he said was very good.  Free wifi, outdoor seating.  On Sundays, it's just a block away from the new N. Beach farmer's market.

NK5JRQE9mQERAMBFxR3m6A.review_text: Best cappuccino I had in 4 days all over town.

NZF71V_G0LfQeMp8BXaTCA.review_text: I discovered this place a few months ago, during my last semester in law school. They are wonderful here. Free wi-fi, delicious coffee, and the food is good too. I recommend the pear and honey salad. The owners are wonderful people, and will let me order just an iced tea and sit here for hours studying. I'd been bouncing around from cafe to cafe in North Beach trying to find a place where I could sit and study, and this place is the best. It isn't too loud, the music is nice, and they don't come around and harass you every hour like some of the other places up on Columbus.  Jesse and Alex are selling the place though in a couple of months, which is sad, but the new owners supposed to be keeping everything the same.
