I highly recommend this place if you're looking for an easy going, relaxed environment to chill, study, get some work done, or just enjoy a delicious cup of coffee or lunch!   The only downside is that they do close at 6pm... It's not that early, but I'd like it if they remained open a couple more hours in the evening.

qGT5bSIIwGlHbX_ocEIDUQ.review_text: This has turned into my favorite cafe in North Beach.  I think they make the best coffee in the 'hood, and people who REALLY appreciate their coffee seem always to rank it highly.  They have some good sandwiches and excellent vegan fruit pies. You can get a real meal here, not just a pastry snack.  And the staff is super nice.  Free wi-fi!  It's also not in the center of all the hustle and bustle of North Beach, which I really appreciate on a weekend morning.

4Z7oCyogvhWw3DDMo7oBFA.review_text: They would not honor the free item offered fro checking in on Yelp but they make a great Proscuitto Panini and let me camp out and use their free WiFi for about to hours so I can't complain

dwhDaHf6I0kcncAzo6VSxA.review_text: So, I only come here because its directly across the street from the closest laundromat near me and for the wi-fi. I was so excited when I saw this place being constructed because I liked the awning and how they advertised the promotion of drinking wine during the day. Once I finally experienced it though it was a let down. Ive had one good and reasonably priced pannini but the coffee quality was poor as is the wine selection and salads. 3 stars because its so close to where I live, free Wi-Fi and a cute waitress.

sx9SmmgrCjjmzjW-fXWbyg.review_text: Awesome little place!!  Best latte ever, awesome Chicken Caesar Wrap & Caprese Pannini and the Mimosa was prepared with a generous amount of champagne!!!

gG6FFEEVRf9qu0cMqosSQg.review_text: nice coffee shop in my neighborhood. The coffee was very good. They know how to foam soy milk perfectly and you'll get some coffee art on your cappuccino or latte.  They carry vegan pies too! Great place to go have a leisurely saturday morning coffee/snack.

Jc69-Q9hOmiCULiHnRPheA.review_text: I love this place. I have been going here for a couple years now.  I am a cappuccino lover, I will only go to a few places in the city and this is a winner.   Out of all the places I go for good espresso this one has the most to offer. They have salads and other yummy fresh-food items, electrical outlets and outdoor seating.  There prices are great, too.

0QLMxQmYMkRrSV1Mcmpuxw.review_text: New owners are great. Coffee is made by French press and is excellent. Food is very good, too. Best cafe in the area.

qrviSuPe5fE-pHfiKFvJEw.review_text: My wife and I stopped here for coffee while in SF for Escape from Alcatraz Triathlon.  My experience here was limited, but the coffee is truly top-notch.

UyQNFKPF8BtNpKiOrXCMQg.review_text: Recently came up for a quick 4-day visit to the Bay Area and decided to check this place out because well, my best friend and I were super hungry and Mama's Cafe a few blocks away closed upon our arrival. I don't think I'll quite understand the early closing of cafes in SF. I like to sleep in thank you very much... maybe it's me? Maybe it's a Southern Californian thing? Whatever. Back to Cafe Crap-iccio...  Verdict: Caprese panini = whatever. Acceptable, edible, satisfying-ish.  Latte = on point. Really delicious, authentic, fresh espresso and soy milk. Free wi-fi = yay! Great place to get work and studying done.  Maybe I came in with higher expectations... I don't know. But $11 for mediocre sandwiches and a latte is not where the money's at. You're better off getting a sandwich and coffee at Nordstrom Cafe. At least you'll be able to shop afterwards!

vc9zEAbb2GJMMJ75bPbsvw.review_text: Okay, First the good stuff! Alex and Jessie are two of the nicest people you'll ever meet. That, combined with all of the delicious dishes that they serve, should be reason enough to go there now. In fact I just got back!  Now the bad stuff... They are the *new* owners of this cafe, not the *old* owners that people here are complaining about. That's not really the bad stuff btw, what's bad is that Yelp refuses to take down reviews about the former owners' spousal abuse and poor customer service that don't have anything to do with the great folks that own this cafe now and their business is potentially being harmed by this practice.  Please come by and try the food and drinks here, you'll enjoy yourself and will help right a wrong.

Tj-dZQNgz2pNpBGLvCkm6A.review_text: I've been here a few times, and I tired to really like it because I live so close, but in the end I couldn't force it. I would be ok paying their elevated prices if I was getting the right quality in return, but I haven't had anything that impressive yet. The lox and bagels (my personal breakfast favorite) was exceedingly mediocre and not at all worth the 9 bucks.... I don't think the atmosphere or cafe itself is that impressive either. Maybe I'm missing something, but I'll be sticking to other cafes in the area

UWbroyc9GGoZMvwpSmvVCg.review_text: I have some mixed feelings on this place.....I really like sitting outside here, the street is not as busy as Columbus and you can just chill there for as long as you want.  The food I have had there was quite good, and I like the European feel that the place has.  On the other hand, the guy behind the counter is not very nice.  I've seen him yell at employees and that's kind of awkward...I definitely would not want to work there!  As someone who has worked in the service industry I take that into consideration.  Not cool!

5P9y1rlgX5fuauKvXatopQ.review_text: Delicious caprese sandwich (unbelievable bread) came with a tasty side salad.  Great place to sit outside on a nice day.  Latte to go kept me moving up and over Nob Hill.

gnlv90bq-zwAXmPCpz7LRw.review_text: this place is completely necessary in the culinary desert that is the general fisherman's wharf region.  i dont drink coffee (despite working in a cafe) so i can't speak for their coffee and fancy espresso drinks. but i do eat panini and salads. and they do both of those really well here.  the funny thing is, i hated the real italian panini in italy because they were too simple and usually just contained some processed ham ingredient like speck or proscuitto. and i hate most of the "panini" in the US because its the extreme opposite, stuffed with six cheeses and mayo and every type of meat and vegetable farmed in this country. basically just deluxe subs thrown on a sandwich press. the only type of panini i actually like is the type they have at a lot of little italian cafes in new york, not overstuffed with random non-italian crap but not too plain either.  so i guess thats what this place has, new york italian-american panini. and its served on this soft flattened baguette-like bread that doesnt break your teeth.  the interior is really clean and new looking, and on a sunny day its nice to sit at one of the little outside tables and be far enough away from the wharf to not smell rotting fish in the air.

5j0QmE-ktdY2wfEYX2YStA.review_text: Ive been here a few times. The first, I was with a group of friends from the UK. The drinks took over 20 minutes to get to our table and were prepared one by one, the food took an hour. It was pretty good.   The other times I have been here the service has been quicker but I have not ordered food again.   I am boycotting this restaurant as I have heard they treat their staff incredibly poorly and the way the owners conduct themselves behind the counter is far from professional. ( i,e the guy shouting at his wife in front of customers).  I loved the idea of this cafe. So close to where I live, a lovely cute Mediterranean feel, and a menu to make your mouth water. It's just a shame the people that run it are such a disappointment.

SPgga_p1VUzKb-SRvvF9sA.review_text: The service was excellent and so was everything that I ordered! Their soup, panini, and pie is so good. I enjoyed every part of it. I definitely recommend this place to everyone and I will be visiting again very soon :)

m1dXgBVwO4c_VO498DcKvA.review_text: Gerardo is the owner. Awesome guy and funny as hell. He will do whatever it takes to make sure you're happy with your order. I had a dirty chai latte with soy...yummmy.  Other great things to mention: good work place with wifi. great location. Outdoor seating. clean bathroom!

s93PtWbODlx8h5IK86CVSA.review_text: Solid coffee, as many yelpers have already said.  The "small" is very tiny. I guess most "real" cafes have very petite smalls-- I apologize, I'm from suburbia where we really only have Starbucks and Tully's...  I've been for coffee and it looked like a nice, friendly cafe so I went for lunch as well. I had the smoked salmon bagel with cream cheese, capers and red onions. Very yummy-- slightly pricey at over $7.   My boyfriend had their grilled chicken sandwich which he was very pleasantly surprised to find had hummus in it. The perfect addition :) It was $8.50 or so.   These aren't your everyday deli kinda sandwiches-- if you're looking for a slightly classier version of a deli sandwich, go here. Otherwise, head to Freddie's Sandwiches for cheaper sandos.   BUT, for great coffee with complimentary wireless, this place is unbeatable! All of their pastries are absolutely delightful and everyone here is really nice.  Plus, they have books you can browse through-- some true classics and some CA tourism books :)

AwvwZOOhLouAjj_5RuqsrA.review_text: I love this place! The staff is very nice and patient. :) The decoration on the foam of my latte is beautiful, and it is always strong and delicious!  Breakfast bagel sandwich.. Mmmm!

yQx9MNPW-XvPMNpHQBjxEg.review_text: Pros: This little neighborhood cafe has great snacks and it's usually empty enough for the wifi to seem fast and for it to be quiet :)  Cons: The lighting is not that appropriate for working on the laptop for a long time, but you can easily fix that by sitting close to the windows!

fHkp6WGwESrTVsg9nreWnA.review_text: In town for a night before a trip to Napa....This was THE BEST Latte i have ever had! Such a rich, roasted flavor w perfect foam art...Sit by the window for a little breeze of a crisp morning air   perfect way to start day  Such a cozy place.  Service was super friendly

O-1WSZmERAutIAtyF7wDEg.review_text: Possibly the best latte I have ever had.  Food is really good too.  Fast, friendly service plus free wifi!

Jwm9nGa7PBLm2NoT-jeDtA.review_text: Visiting San Francisco for work and found this gem via Yelp. It's cozy with character and the staff are very friendly. I worked on my laptop from 11:00 a.m. - 3:30 p.m. and not once did I ever feel like they were trying to get me out of there. Free wifi, plenty of outlets and amazing lounge/chill music. For eats/drinks, I had a cappuccino, double espresso and prosciutto panini - all were amazing!

2qkOI-p3B4g7fKG_lMZMCg.review_text: The restaurant is famous for breakfast and deservedly so. The choices, the quality of the food and the ambience are all very good. The service was good.

ZCzRcRKJ6n8joppQi6zjog.review_text: I still dream about this place!  I don't even know where to begin. We visited Cafe Capriccio during our trip to SF. The reviews seemed good but do not do this place justice! It was so good that we went back two days later. It was so good that I still try to replicate my breakfast there now that I am back home. The ingredients used by that cafe are definitely the fresh of the fresh, the best of the best. My favorite was the breakfast parfait. The hot chocolate was as equally delicious as the fresh squeezed orange juice and the multi-grain toast with the salted cream butter and real strawberry jam were out of this world.   I'm truly saddened that this place is all the way across the country and that I cannot truly replicate it's deliciousness. Cafe Capriccio is an absolute gem, not just to the neighborhood but to the world of cafes in general. If you are looking for a good cup of coffee (or hot chocolate) and want to accompany it with a delicious yet fresh breakfast, this is your place.

J2j0PBxPAXU5i7M0rrgfGg.review_text: When you are in that dicey tourista section of San Francisco the heart wonders "oh no--just Starbucks!?" But luckily tucked away a bit and a welcomed relief for the tongue.  French Press coffee with the finest of deep bold grounds; I enjoyed an Ethiopian coffee; there was water for a quick hydration.  Nice and friendly and such cute environs.

nvpWH_DUOJB9fHYeqdTNxQ.review_text: Yes, there is fine coffee in North Beach.  This places rocks.  Their barista is an artist who works hard to make a smooth espresso that is not bitter, burnt, sour, or over priced like most other cafes in North Beach. They use Echo brand coffee.  Soo good.

kzTDJ4Vgzz_Hjix1YPi4Vw.review_text: Great morning breakfast spot. They have a nice selection of baked goods, quiches, granola, etc.  I got a panini and my friend got the mushroom quiche. Everything was fresh delicious, and affordable. I would recommend this spot if you're looking for a quick bite without breaking the bank.

8QBlOpTcgkldhBtq-4A7YA.review_text: Underwhelming. It's pretty average so if you're looking for something special, this isn't the place.

_98SIg0Pev8eG2xZhib__A.review_text: One star because the mocha I ordered was tasty.  Otherwise, it was not a great experience.  I ordered a small mocha for the high price of $3.75.  When I received my beverage, it was SO tiny.  I think it was 8 ounces, maybe smaller.  I'm fine with an 8 ounce mocha, but it should have been about dollar less expensive.  The cup was so small that the cardboard sleeve didn't even fit around the cup!  Also, there was no whipped cream.  I thought that would be standard.    Additionally, the food display cases did not look clean or appetizing, and the guy working the cash register was coughing, sneezing, and wiping his nose on the back of his hand and never washed his hands!  Gross!  I like supporting neighborhood businesses, but this place didn't give me any warm fuzzies about paying a higher price for a good experience.

rHBtyq9TYwxMiqiGKelX_g.review_text: It's been a long time since I have had an amazing latte so leaving a review was a must. Silky smooth foam, delicious espresso. I have been back morning and evening for this drink. Their chocolate croissants are also super super delicious and I compare them to some of the other great ones I've had in Morocco and Costa Rica. I wish I had a little café like this near my house. Thanks for enhancing my short holiday from San Diego.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: What a cozy, mellow cafe shop right at the center of a residential neighborhood of North Beach!  Somewhat hipster ambiance with their cushioned wall seats!  I like!  With the pouring rain outside, warm cup of cappuccino, comfortable seats and complimentary Wi-Fi, I was lingering here for some hours!  They provide a stamp card - for the 10th cup of coffee, it will be on the house!  It is definitely a low key cafe shop and that makes it a great place to be at just because it truly provides a time for oneself to be concentrating on stuff to do!

D_MR0falcGODjMOZoS_W9w.review_text: GreatGreat morning spot!  Quality coffee made with care.  They have a nice selection of baked goods, quiches, granola, etc.  Sidewalk seating for those spring and fall mornings.   Nice wines in the afternoon and eve...this is a perfect little spot to meet a couple of friends and hang out.  Enjoy.

VRNF7v9PRqnfU3XpNmRxpQ.review_text: very cozy coffee spot tasty soy latte small seating area inside and some spots outside too friendly staff

XBXyyTClrFHHHTI28HsqpA.review_text: Nice casual cafe. Beautiful coffee and breakfast treats.  Coffee is proper barista style coffee ( not drip filtered)! Free wifi and power sockets for charging.  Relaxed and friendly atmosphere.

sSIsqHgWruKWRb4SyIRXLQ.review_text: While in SF, we walked by this place, and decided to get lunch here. We only got two things, calamari and a mushroom pizza.  Both were so fresh and delicious. We actually ordered a second pizza because it was so good.

6-AqJH4LlZBidRJbgUFeWw.review_text: Has to have the best lattes / chai lattes in the city.  You wont be able to go to starhucks after getting coffee here.  Good froth & not boiling hot so you can drink it right away. Outdoor seating is nice as well.

dO3ikdceUFb_6wa1YR53OQ.review_text: great ambiance, food is delicious, not heavy or greasy at all, super healthy options and flavour-packed.... quieche egg wrap and chicken panini... winning choices...oh and great cappuccino

Ri_oAGW6OcO5_WDbJ4A5rA.review_text: Good food but cashier lady was impatient when we were a bit not sure what kind of coffee we wanted. Not a smart way to treat tourists.

8526ZJhSR9CEX-vfjSFD-w.review_text: i love this place.  one, its clean.  two, the seating is very comfortable with pillows.  three, there are multiple outlets. four, free wi-fi. five, love the air work and the ambiance.   chai latte.... delicious.  smoked salmon bagel... the bagel is to small for everything in it! roasted chicken panini... love it with the hummus.  definitely going back there soon!

UiKgsMJV_s2sOT9x21DZog.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
UiKgsMJV_s2sOT9x21DZog.review_text: I can't say enough nice things about this place. Great coffee, nice staff, good service, not too crowded, free Wi-Fi, loyalty program with free drink after 10 purchases, sidewalk tables. It's everything a neighborhood java joint should be. Way better than 901 Columbus Caffe a few blocks away.

6OwEseljNOF0WCU3qeteBg.review_text: First time here and definitely not the last!! The workers are very friendly. The food is really fresh and yummy. I ordered the hummus plate and it was SO delicious! Plus, free WiFi!! 10/10 recommend :)

4d5kZit_8oh10s80jfz4QQ.review_text: I looked in there and thought I would skip it, the coffee couldn't be good.   I mean, nice enough spot, but I wanted a good coffee. Later I was invited me for coffee there  .....  Whatever it was, the coffee there some of the best in San Francisco.  I had the capooch...

gk9jsfaU3RoomWmfoW1tlw.review_text: Ah! What a great latte. They were invariably sold out of the oatmeal every time I came here, but they had nice, fresh pastries from local bakeries to make me feel better about it. And of course, all can be forgiven because of the coffee. Did I say 'what a great latte'? I shall say it again.

e53cYSPf4v51YmPH2_ludw.review_text: Cute cafe! The bagel with lox, tomato, cream cheese, and onion was really good! I like how they made the bagel sandwich neat and manageable instead of stuffing it sky-high or lopsided so that it becomes a huge mess when you try to eat it (that's kind of a pet peeve of mine). The mocha with whipped cream on top was great. Service was great. Sat outside, very nice.

B9YstM-Lu1xKfYYgDjUMpQ.review_text: You probably shouldn't come here. It's a real gem and I'd like to keep it all to myself. OK? OK, thanks.

ktWY99kJmauw_p3H-aUnvg.review_text: A nice cafe serving delicious panini and mimosa made with fresh squeezed orange juice. Had a beautiful afternoon at the patio area, a peaceful spot in North Beach.

ddyOFrSxlqcIo-p--x51mQ.review_text: Cafe Capriccio is the best! I am excited each morning to stroll down the block and start my day with the perfect triple mocha with whip. Their customer service is the best and the coffee is strong and persistent. Of all the spots in North Beach, Cafe Capriccio is my favorite find.

kN5TZU_4cngfQY8B6PYx1g.review_text: A+ - friendly staff A+ - enough outlets for many laptops A+ - free WiFi A+ - takes debit/credit cards A+ - wine while you relax in a comfortable atmosphere  Yay, Capriccio!

Dw5JzepBLJ-L_DAUseocHg.review_text: Between the thoughtful service (they take advance calls for orders -- like a pizza place), comfortable seating (padded benches and back pillows), and quality of food/drink I highly recommend this place.  Was originally owned by a wonderful couple but nothing has changed since then :)

1UKab-nmvbBoyp6y6f052A.review_text: This is the neighborhood go-to spot for breakfast bagel sandwiches on a Saturday morning.  I love the neighborhood vibe here.  Plus, it is a really relaxed and cozy spot to dip in on a crisp SF morning.  Depending on your mood, you can appreciate its coziness over Francisco Cafe (preferable if you feel like having more light and space) and quieter than Columbus Cafe (preferable if you want a whole plethora of drink options and watching America's Cup on TV).        The ham and cheese croissant sandwich is very filling.  Also, the lox sandwich was fresh, which is a nice surprise, considering this is not a NY bagel store.  I also like their soup and quiche.  However, the blueberry pie was a bit tart for my taste, but that's OK...  should cut back on sweets, anyway.  Chai tea and coffee come in big mugs, which I appreciate.        I love it here!  Everyone is really friendly, too.

miY7B32VgfHsdRoVP9Nl-A.review_text: Saw this super cute cafe and happened to find it on restaurant.com awhile back. Finally went in with it a couple months later and was partially greeted with attitude that they did not accept restaurant.com vouchers anymore and that they stopped the deal. Told them that they should still honor my deal and they begrudgingly did it. Ordered my food and no other words were exchanged. Panini was meh. No flavor. Cafe vibe was okay that day. It was just off-putting in general. Perhaps a bad day to come in. Next time- I'll bring my laptop and order a latte instead.

gjfcfzrYZ0O1xINHtnQKiA.review_text: A hidden gem on the corner for coffee and tea aficionados with the bonus of great snacks and dishes.  Some highlights include their African red bush tea and chocolate or almond croissants as well as the fig, ricotta and proscuitto bruschetta.  It's a great place to chat outside or indoors as well as get some work done.  Several parents chill here before picking up kids from the pre-school across the street.    Service is fast, friendly and helpful.  The decor is simple and clean with ample seating for hanging out.  Parking is on the street.

9jXWui2JfiBOiFD3oi7XyQ.review_text: Good coffee. Well priced egg wrap & chocolate croissant was good

sXveccnC4lMGJwx0Jhxhqw.review_text: Great place when the sun is shining - you can people watch as folks walk in and out of the main area of north beach while enjoying the light and some wonderful coffee (or, if you're me, a glass of wine).   I had the ricotta, fig and prosciutto bruschetta, which was on a really thick, well-toasted piece of bread. It was delicious, although could have used a touch more of the fig jam to offset the heavyness of the pork. But overall it was a lovely meal, especially to just munch and enjoy outdoors. All in all, fantastic atmosphere and tasty food/wine - a must-try.

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: really hungry, it's two blocks from work, and totally happy with my pastries this morning. the croissant was buttery, flaky, and amazing while the blueberry cheese danish was my absolute favorite pastry that i have had in awhile. i loved how i was able to taste each and every fresh blueberry in the danish, it wasn't too sweet, and flaky. Mmmm Need to come back to try some more goodies

qj6sqH7tvELjO-dmKoiTpg.review_text: Great little place to grab some caffeine in the morning. As far as food goes I've only tried the breakfast egg sandwich and it was just ok. The staff was friendly and I'll certainly be going back.

McWGE_7t-ZQpxawR8nGjxQ.review_text: This is my favorite place to get a cup of mocha! Their drinks in general have great taste and consistency. When I had come back from Quebec it was so hard to get used to plain starbucks and peets. Don't get me wrong, I still drink it. But Cafe Crapiccio is what I was looking for. ;P Their sandwiches are really good. Didn't enjoy their quiches as much.

nOe5dewI3cYT9oWwPZ2XeA.review_text: Girl behind the counter needs an attitude adjustment. Slow service, ok food, ok coffee, wifi inconsistent. But don't complain about the wifi to the girl working there because she'll tell you it's working, although it's not, but she'll give you a dose of her attitude and make it a whole ordeal.

nQPK4pBDlxXNBaYIt87VQg.review_text: Salmon bagel was DELICIOUS. Coffee prepared with care. I like that.

4ssDCBvb9LC2cMpWxjhpRQ.review_text: Sitting in a nice little bistro table in the sun enjoying my coffee and egg wrap was nice.  Everything was fresh and tasty.

qGckwq34UeOe3joG2nP1OQ.review_text: Nice spot to sit outside and do some work or read but I was expecting better food. I had a wrap and salad and neither were too great but overall it's a solid location especially on a sunny day.

WatN4YVDRNHbS7SwZwUGAg.review_text: They have a wine bar now! Thursday through Saturday nights from 6-9PM! Buy two flights, get a free cheese plate. I freakin' love this place.

viVgjtei9vWe4UQBW3SuSQ.review_text: While visiting San Francisco (and starving after a tour of Alcatraz), I used Yelp to find a cafe or bistro nearby to grab lunch. The reviews for Cafe Capriccio were good and although it seemed that most people were fans of the drinks, a lot of mention was made about the food there. Since it was close by, my family and I decided to stop there.   The cafe looked quite cute on the outside, but when I stepped inside, it felt cramped and dark and muggy. (Granted, it was raining, so perhaps "muggy" isn't the norm there). Other Yelp reviewers mentioned baked goods in their reviews, but the baked good display case looked rather empty.  Seating was extremely limited - I suppose people were working from there since everyone seemed to have a computer.  I ordered a caprese sandwich, which did seem to be fresh and was loaded with mozzarella - but even with fresh basil and pesto on the sandwich, I found it to be really bland and lacking in flavor. The sandwich was served with a side salad of mixed greens rather than chips, which was a nice touch, although the vinaigrette dressing was nothing to write home about. My meal was okay, I suppose, but it was a disappointment after seeing such great reviews and knowing that there were plenty of other outstanding places to eat nearby.   Everyone else in my family seemed to agree with me - their food was okay, but bland and nothing special.

NJkKim1vaowyEKtazPdByw.review_text: I have been coming here for over a year, it is great to watch these guys get better and better.  The coffee is organic, something they don't advertise.  Actually, a lot of the food they use is organic, sustainable, or of high quality.  Like the yummy Diestel turkey panino.  This hidden gem is the best coffee in North Beach.  They serve Ecco Caffe, known in coffee circles as one of the best roasters in the country.

kUFgqfZ1JkNzsdN4DuaYJw.review_text: Here, Cafe Capriccio in 5 glorious phrases:  1. Giant, homey mugs 2. PILLOWS! 3. Password-free, fast Wifi 4. Baristas chatting (maybe about you) in Italian 5. Small but punchy salads  I wish they were open later, so I could enjoy their trendy European tunes and carry my enthusiastic typing into the evening. I seem to be more productive here than in my apartment, the library, yeah! But then again, I'm no serial coffee drinker and the stuff here is strong. Whatevs. Confounding variables of Cafe Capriccio atmosphere and caffeine. They do well fusing the two for me.

0t-O5--DOfS55A620fO_GA.review_text: **Use the Yelp check-in deal! ($15 for $10)**  I've never roasted an establishment based on service-- I'm more into the food, value, and atmosphere. Seriously. Ugh! There's a first for everything I guess!  Before I even placed my order I was barked at by the barista. Two young ladies lined up to place an order behind me and all three of us were scolded because we weren't standing close enough to the counter. Thankfully the young man that took my order was friendly and pleasant. I grabbed my number and made my way to a table outside to enjoy he amazing San Fran sunny weather.   A few minutes passed and the crabby barista came out with my cappuccino. Again, she scolded me! She made some snide comment about how my coffee was probably cold because she was calling my number for awhile now. Um, you didn't think to go outside?!? It's not like this place is big or anything! The two young ladies that ordered behind me were now sitting at the table next to me, so they witnessed both of my scoldings. All three of us chuckled at how bizarre the barista's crappy attitude was and joked that she must be having a bad day. (On a side note, several yelp reviews mention this barista and her crappy attitude, so I doubt it was an off day) They decided that they didn't want to get yelled at by the barista so one of them went inside to pick up their drinks.   Anyway, the coffee is excellent and the food is pretty good! The outdoor seating is great along the streets of this quiet part of North Beach.   5 stars for food and coffee, 2 stars for service (the order-taker guy was friendly). Also, props for free wifi so I could sit outside and type up this review on my iPad!)

li85I9BtJme3KAmN02CzEQ.review_text: Ok, i am lazy and unemployed which are two things that compound each other to last a bit longer then they really need too.  however, i have come up with a few "strategies" which help these problems and one of them involves Cafe Capriccio.  As i live in the Mission and have wireless (borrowed from my neighbor) i decided to find a nice local spot on the other side of the city which forces me to get off my butt and actually refrain from cuddling up with my laptop in bed all day long watching Hulu.  so my criteria is a place which has the following: quality breakfast tea cheap breakfast free wireless (Starbucks wireless is not free) Bike rack seating outside  LOT of outlets.  Well, needless to say Cafe Capriccio has these all in spades.  The breakfast burrito is fresh and made to order while their croissant are actual flaky butter croissants and not the ones you buy from Costco.  so pop on down and say hello as i am the pasty white redheaded guy in the back trying looking for a job while sneaking handfuls of blueberries from under the table.

DJFMK-AFPKIFue7hgl676A.review_text: I used to come here when it was still under the previous ownership. The lunch portion was too small so I didn't come back again until recently I decided to give it a try again even though the new owner has been operating for more than one year.  I like the present one so much that I came back three times during one week. The barista knows well what he's doing. The chicken caesar salad wrap came with green salad. Very delicious and the portion of the wrap was so big that I had to take half of the wrap home. My husband had tuna salad wrap and it was very good too. A wonderful neighborhood gem.

X_gJvizrZLyfBy0BLDkIQQ.review_text: We were in SF from Chicago, and after waiting 20 mins in the Mama's on Washington line, we decided to ditch it for this place. We were not disappointed!! The caprese panini was amazing! I loved it so much that I went back the next day to get another. Will definitely recommend!

xTCHjpvKXBHmsEzlB5h5lA.review_text: TL;DR: I had one tiny slice of ham on my ham and cheese bagel, and they were out of two things I wanted.  This place was pretty disappointing considering its rating. Traveling here from Portland I was looking for a good breakfast sandwich and coffee to have fuel for walking around.  Ordered a chai, they're out. Okay no big. I'll take a latte. Ordered a ham and cheese croissant, no croissants. Hm okay. I'll take a ham and cheese bagel.  There was A slice of processed ham on my bagel with cheese that was barely toasted. Like one. The funny thing is I was charged the full 5.95 for a ham and cheese croissant. Also on their menu if you were to add ham or bacon to any other sandwich it's $1.50! I'll be walking straight to the pier for a cup of clam chowder   I swear I'm not hard to please, this girl just wants a little protein!   To end this on a positive note and what earned them a third star: their vanilla latte was delicious and really well made.

BDzCb34GmdUWK-G1FwMCmw.review_text: I am only reviewing the two things I've tried: Chai and butter croissants and ice tea.  And both are fan-freakin'-tastic!  Chai is some of the best every, perfectly frothy and smooth, sugary, but not too sweet, and the perfect temperature!  And the croissants are also fabulous - a lovely pick me up on a Saturday am, but beware - they run out quickly!  Ice Tea is great - although I wish they gave it to me in a bigger glass. Great flavor though.  A lovely neighborhood joint for a cup o' anything on a sunny afternoon.  Oh and they also have such a lovely interior!

k_PSkYpsex3vP-f08xfGxg.review_text: If you are looking for some great coffee in the North Beach / Washington Square Park area, forget about Cafe Trieste - make your way to Cafe Capriccio !!  Think in terms of Blue Bottle / Ritual here...  The new owners Jesse & Alex, while very young - have put a lot of effort into making sure the espresso drinks are of great quality. Just check out my pics here on Yelp !  Cappuccinos & lattes are made "Blue Bottle" style - with that great micro-foamed steamed milk, with the beans courtesy of Ecco Coffee (Sonoma). The barista in the mornings seems to put a lot of effort into each drink - you may be waiting for a minute longer - but the results - AWESOME.  Food is great too , with huge salads & tasty sandwiches at a great price with huge portions. Decent beer & wine selection.

WKPTh4UmEqXR8TRAp1g2CA.review_text: Excellent lattes & a good spot for an alternate "office"- free wifi, caffeine, and outlets. I was the only one not using a Mac, so I felt a little dirty, but not so dirty that I won't be back.

LSQsSMYUdxPs8VXFeYThyQ.review_text: Down the block from where I work.  Amazing breakfast bagel sandwiches: I've had the chance to taste: egg+cheese, egg+cheese+ham, and egg+cheese+bacon. Not sure which one is my favorite, but you can choose what kind of bagel you want, (I prefer wheat) and it comes with tomatoes, tastes so good. Coffee is just alright, but it hits the spot when you need your fix in the morning.  All are good choices, can't really go wrong. Very friendly.

aZsqL0a9KY0C0bYQo16Hfw.review_text: Best part about San Francisco! great coffee with the cute little foam designs and the croissant sandwich was pretty good as well (can't remember the actual name). This place is absolutely fantastic!

Ov-HxS7vDObYZZBdezOg8Q.review_text: The Cafe Capriccio came recommended to us by a San Francisco local. We had a fairly pleasant experience.   The Cafe itself has an excellent atmosphere. As advertised by it's sign, free wifi is offered and the Cafe is packed with college students and other working people with their laptops. It had some tables, and some couches, providing a nice experience.  The food was very good, although the menu was not huge. I had the prosciutto panini, which I would definitely recommend. They do serve wine, as well as beer, and coffee. We did not have a coffee ourselves but it looked and smelled absolutely excellent.  The main problem I had was the staff. They were somewhat friendly, but did not seem to have knowledge of the menu. I asked if they were serving breakfast still, and they seemed unsure. I ordered a breakfast item, they checked to see if they had it (they didn't) and so I had to order something else.  However, it is a fun cafe with a great environment (especially if you have work to get done) and good food.

bE5Swrp3qwsgA_SyVBUfbg.review_text: This cafe is so close to my place that I'm kinda ashamed I didn't hang out here much more often. Although the Starbucks nearby isn't so bad *ambiance wise* really.  The space is kinda tiny and there's really only 1 table where I can look outside. I've tried many of their food/drink: americano, cappuccino, almond croissant, plain croissant, and chai latte. All are really good, although the chai latte is a tad too sweet. Too bad they can't adjust the sweetness other than by reducing the chai powder amount. It's still really good though!  I love the outdoor seating on Chestnut st. Very sunny and don't get too much foot traffic. This city needs more cafe with good outdoor seatings.

7jqs8Fe_gWhJtxUsra-XNA.review_text: Best latte I ever had. Saw and heard all the hype about blue bottle but went here first.  I have to say after having 3 drinks at blue b then coming back the taste, texture and aroma is better for me here.  I would come here everyday if I lived here.

BdiFjWA8JDfDlpjJJNyZeg.review_text: A wonderful neighborhood cafe located off the beaten path in North Beach.    I visit a lot of cafes.  A LOT.  This is a true gem.  The best part, they are so awesome and they don't even know it.  No Baristas With Attitude, just great coffee (Ecco Caffe) served on a pristine Nuova Simonelli Aurelia.  Drip coffee was french pressed and stored in airpots.    I am also glad I got a sandwich.  The food was definitely a good value.  For under 8 bucks, I got a killer Caprese panino.  Bread was from Panorama, the mozzarella was genuine di buffala, the basil was fresh, and the mixed greens were delicious and organic.    The owners are super sweet, though a little green.  Any mistakes are due to inexperience, and not at all intended.  That, of course, will only disappear with time.

ybLqwulHnia8WzRPsdmchg.review_text: I honestly don't know why this place has so many good reviews. I only go here when I do laundry and am never happy. Coffee is not great and service stinks. I never feel like they really care if I am there. Let alone acknowledge me or say hi when I walk in. If they are even close to closing (kinda early by the way) up for the day they kick you out or try to rush you.  I'd rather go to any number of the many coffee shops in North Beach.

kPobzzhCQTddMk98ElBwzg.review_text: too expensive for mediocre food.  moreover the waiter was like - tip should be based on non-coupon total..  how rude.

6Fo8xB96WFj8Bk0AK7fRpQ.review_text: This is my new favorite coffee shop in North Beach. It's nestled away on side streets, which means that it is normally quiet and has more of a neighborhood-feel than its competitors on the main street corners. The music is just loud enough to be pleasant, with good variety, but not so loud that it intrudes on your conversation or concentration. There is a lot of small-table seating and a plethora of wall outlets, so it is a great place to work. Also, the drinks are excellent. I'm not a coffee drinker, but it's the best soy chai in the neighborhood (outside of an Indian restaurant). No watering down the drinks here!  The only thing keeping this cafe from reaching 5-star status is the food. It's fine, it's decent, but its nothing great. If you need a snack while working or studying, it will do, but I wouldn't make the food the primary reason for coming here.

rWS5VS6yTzleYVZGtv_URg.review_text: What can you say about a breakfast place that runs out of Bagel and orange juice before 11 am on a Sunday?? Glad that they didn't run out of the Sunday  morning peace. Glad that they had tables outside and staff that was polite and friendly. But seriously a little bit of planning on the owners part would have made our experience so much better. I'll try to be back, but frankly with so many tempting options around, I doubt it will happen.

DW-ZUWNrsUkx3qYIglwK_w.review_text: Amazing food. So fresh at an affordable price. I loved my breakfast parfait! In a convenient location and one of very few good brunch places in the area. All the food was made on the spot and the ingredients were super fresh.

bsaJhKesaQuPVxP9B35m3A.review_text: Very cute! The beef and cheese sandwich was very delicious. The chai is good but too sweet and not spicy enough. Overall I think lunch cost around 11 bucks, so a bit pricey, but tasty and friendly service.

Fh9NV7echtUcN84hawkBbA.review_text: I was in the area and found this cafe via Yelp. Small, cozy little cafe that serves coffee, lattes, sandwiches, bagels, and such.   The latte was creamy and strong, just the way I like it. I also had the salmon bagel and that was good as well, but nothing to swoon over. The service was friendly and quick. Parking in front of the cafe was closed for construction, but finding parking around the block was easy and not to far away.

bp3gTWRKftxkckub_PfA6A.review_text: Best coffee in the neighborhood, and let me tell you, in this neighborhood good coffee is hard to find. Free wi-fi. Nice atmosphere and friendly, non-pretentious staff.

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: What an adorable little cafe!! We came here to read and get some brunch on Sunday and this place totally won me over. We shared the chicken and caprese panini and I also got a latte.   The latte was rich and super frothy. The coffee flavor was pretty intense and they put a heart design on the foam :). Our sandwiches were also delicious!! The caprese won by a nose, we both thought. The bread were nice and crunchy without being oily and the amount of pesto was just right. The mozzarella was fresh and the tomatoes juicy. The chicken sandwich had crunchy pieces of red onion, which gave it a zing, and the chicken was moist. I would probably ask for no-hummus next time, though.   Another great thing about the sandwiches were the side salad that came with it. It was very fresh and tangy. I think it's probably one of the best salads that I've had. Simple, nothing complicated. Very San Francisco.

HRpB7f9yqlNdFrfOcFoOAw.review_text: the neighborhood cafe! Quiet , small, Quaint, great food, great service, best coffee. They  do foam designs on lattes!! skill, mmmm . Definitely a secret cafe I'm not sure why I'm telling you but I love this place so much I should share some of the secret gems in the city

AjHFgLursLNKyzsqG_Y4VA.review_text: Excellent chai. Artichoke quiche was decent, although heavy on the olives and mushrooms in the inside. Artichoke slices are only on the top!

RGjLWrj_M-E3d5N9y8QA2A.review_text: My husband and I come here every week. We love the relaxed and quiet atmosphere and the wifi is fantastic! There are also power outlets under the table. My husband gets an Americano which he says is not very impressive but I get the cappuccino or Mocha and LOVE it because they make the milk right! Not that foamy mess I usually get in other cafes in SF. Having said that, we are major coffee snobs.   The food is very simple but lovely and the service is great, so if you are looking for omellettes and elaborate breakfasts, this place won't satisfy you.  Overally, quiet, friendly, warm, great coffee, simple delicious food, awesome place to get some work done.

-7gpOFaeyrw5JYBk4iRDvQ.review_text: Cafe Capriccio makes the BEST chai latte I've ever had, and they do it consistently. It keeps me coming back at least once a week. Which is why it pains me to give them fewer than 5 stars.  Their normal operating hours are until 6pm every day except Tuesday, when they close slightly earlier. For the past month, I've come in the afternoon on at least 5 occasions to find them closed early. As far as I can tell there's no pattern to this, and their hours on the door still say they close at 6. So it's very frustrating and a waste of my time when I arrive at 4:30pm, as I did today, and find it closed early.  I'd have no problem if this was an emergency once-in-a-while thing, but it's clearly not, and they haven't updated their business hours to reflect that. So, Yelpers, if you're considering coming by past lunchtime, you'll be taking a chance.

kRIZEt2-Q3h1qsWj5J54EQ.review_text: Easily a 4 star place but the guy behind the counter was such a dud- I had to drop a star just for that. He just stood there. No greeting, no "Can I help you?"...just awkward silence. Latte was creamy and smooth, served at a great temperature. Be aware that their small is about half of a tall at Starbucks. That made me happy, perfect amount for me. If you're in the neighborhood, you should def stop by and check this place. Hopefully awkward guy will have a shot of expresso and liven up!

rWro8f-TGFgHW9fFEyDdeg.review_text: This is one of my favorite coffee places in the city.  I spend most of my time in north beach/russion hill/filmore area.  So, my comparisons are mostly limited to those areas.  For me, Cafe Capriccio is about the atmosphere.  The neighborhood has the right mix of and activity and relaxation and the cafe itself has a great vibe.  I love to kickback outside and just soak in the neighborhood and the sun  (which is surprisingly consistent for SF).

y24s5qgDbBCGSF7yqApFtw.review_text: I wouldn't say there is anything wrong with this place, but there is definitely  better food and ambience out there, especially since North Beach is such a cute area. Cafe capriccio is on a random street corner with not much going on. If you walk up to Washington Square Park area, there are a lot cuter restaurants. The outdoor seating at Cafe Capriccio nice, but then again, there are a lot of places in North Beach with outdoor seating. It's relatively reasonably priced, but I would rather spend a few extra dollars and get better food in a more attractive location.   Foodwise, I had the caprese sandwich which wasn't bad, but I've had better. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this to a friend, but if there no other options, it's not terrible.

YinFrBmGU9G6untsx1dMQA.review_text: Hands down the best place to get espresso north of cafe trieste. The new owners are simply wonderful.

Us9exfUqT1sMUw1uTXFABg.review_text: We moved to the neighborhoold (same block) 2 months ago.  We are ecstatic to have Caffe Cappriccio on the corner.   This is the closest one gets to espresso in Italy.  Si mangia bene qua, il caffe e' ottimo.

xH-aBKtlhY9yaJQpsSJg0w.review_text: I cannot say enough good things about Cafe Capriccio.  I work within a block of this cafe and I eat there at least 4 times a week.  Everything is homemade and you can taste it.  They use only the freshest ingredients.  If you in for a quick lunch, I wouldn't suggest this place.  The service isn't slow it just takes time to make everything for you right there.  They have great breakfast sandwiches and, I've never had one, but I've been told by a very good friend that the croissants there are better than anywhere but France.  I don't know what that means, but if you like croissants, go here.  They've got a great wine selection, too.  -n

YEB1pj90TVwomI97OBqPKQ.review_text: I do not like to be the dissenting voice here.  I yelped this place and had to try it due to the many good reviews.  However, we were disappointed with the food.  We came for breakfast and the food was very average.  Coffee was good.  We had four breakfasts and nothing was above average about it.  There are many cafes in the neighborhood and this does not stand out.  But it is very CUTE!

fxm0zUok6cTE7GCS4f81_A.review_text: Solid mocha and hummus. The chicken felt a little dry though. We went on a saturday for lunch and was not particularly crowded which I liked. The outdoor seating was perfect with Coit tower peeking from behind a neighborhood building.   I will come here for the drinks but hit up other spots in the neighborhood for lunch.

PUgZrMBCU6-gqlJuBgYcjg.review_text: Omg, very delicious coffee!! Love the service, love their coffee "design" with the foam. I ordered cappuccino and mocha. It was fascinating (my mom and I can be picky with coffee)

nfxndeptiTZLRpA670AS7g.review_text: Cafe Capriccio was less than half a block from our hotel, so we had to try it. It was a nice neighborhood cafe. The quiche was my choice and was very good, although a little pricey. The coffee and chai were top notch! I would recommend this place.

enIWJGnvGkr4e8r26HmN7Q.review_text: I think this is the best place to get a cappuccino or latte in North Beach. Very consistent, very delicious and perfect foam every time. Not that airy, bubbly foam. It's smooth and creamy the way it should be. Only one thing wrong with the place is the owner - the blonde woman (I think it is a husband/wife team) is nice enough, but she's not very warm. I hardly ever see her smile and sometimes in the morning, you want to be greeted with a smile and recognition from your local coffee shop.

EeNxafbMAJg7m4mIe1h95A.review_text: We went here because the reviews on yelp looked promising. I ordered the ham and cheese croissant and a chia because I'd read good things about both. The person I was with ordered an oatmeal and a hot chocolate. We got our drinks quickly, but they were ridiculously hot and my chia tasted like it had a few shots of espresso in it which wasn't what I thought I was ordering. The ham and cheese croissant was burnt and the oatmeal was kind of bland. The service here leaves something to be desired as they people working that morning were inconsistent in the way the food was delivered. They expected patrons to pick up drinks at the counter, but delivered the food to the table. Overall we won't be going back.

5eHa4S_PXdoznyEGDNRztQ.review_text: A cute little place for either an afternoon leisure or an on-the-go breakfast. I recommend the almond croissant, quite reminiscent of the ones I has in Paris.

z-L7nBwIm2bgFx96NV-loQ.review_text: New management sucks. I ordered the egg wrap (tomato, egg, cheese and bacon). Not only were they out of tomatoes without telling me but they forgot to add the bacon. It costs extra to add bacon. This guy would have found a way to screw up yogurt and fruit.

mDbsLpJ6iV07fAiQy589Lw.review_text: Perfect place to come to relax, study or work. Free wifi (need to ask for password), plenty of outlets, cushion settings with pillows. The staff is friendly and provides a welcoming environment.

RsY9F3-xw3l3qDojahFSpQ.review_text: This was was ok. I would actually call it pretty mediocre. I got the cheddar roast beef melt. The sandwich wasn't much, but it contained soo much horseradish I couldn't taste anything and it cleared my sinuses. With that much horseradish, anything could have been on the sandwich and it would taste the same. I also thought the price of this place was a little ridiculous for what it is. So many other sweet lunch spots in North Beach. This was one of my least favorites.

1NHberk02xgCXUoRGjuK0w.review_text: Delicious! Panini caprese with a salad and spritz on a warm afternoon. The outdoor tables are fun to sit at and watch SF life before your eyes.

yj1I03EW4ZheWLFEJIdRIg.review_text: After being in SF on business (I'm from Houston), I stayed an extra day to see the sights. Was going to eat at Pat's Cafe but (fortunately) it wasn't open yet. Desparately needed coffee so kept walking and happened on CC. Glad I did. The danish was tasty and the panini with jam was simple and delicious. The star of the show, however, was the French Press Coffee... Fantastic!!! This place has a cool and comfortable vibe. Will be hitting this place up again next time I'm in town.

p3aOu-ooA3V6yq58qOJetA.review_text: I don't really remember too much about the place... I would have forgotten to write a review if I did not check in here. :P  I think my husband ordered a quiche.  I saw that people can use free wifi here. Self-service  Um...that's it.

Q_LoT7uKTgznikHLSfKG2g.review_text: Smoked salmon bagel was delicious and was brought to me quickly after I could finally make my order. The waiter left me waiting at the terrace 15 min after telling me to sit there so he'd come take my order right away. When I stepped back into the restaurant, he seemed to be unwinding, taking his time slowly washing glasses and other dishes.

nCCCow84ozoIqbjevZH8uw.review_text: This is a nice little tucked away cafe. I was looking to kill some time and came upon this place. It's a real cozy environment and has comfortable seating. I ordered a ham & cheese bagel and chai. The chai was one of the best I have ever had! It is a great place to catch a snack and relax. They have wifi there also which came really handy. Overall the business was very clean including the restroom. Priced a little high for what I got but the environment and wifi made up for it.

4HeDkrTsapL8IclSL1cT_Q.review_text: Ive seen some good pics on yelp and thought i try it out. I came here in the morning. I love mocha's and was really looking forward to see some latte art which they failed Guess its a newbie barista. Anyways I had a mocha and the egg wrap. The mocha and the egg wrap was juz...meh. I should have tried their bagels instead. On the upside it is a Cozy place to do my writing since the atmosphere of the dining area has a warm feel to it plus they have free wifi but again most coffee shops in sf have wifi. Nothing special.

eA91tgqdKxJx0Rwekh7E1g.review_text: Given the photos of the cappuccinos and great reviews, I had quite high expectations. Unfortunately, Capriccio came in way under the bar. The espresso was badly burned and the milk was scalded.  A cappuccino should not have to sit for 3 minutes in order not to burn your mouth.  I might give it another try (could it have been a one time thing???? I don't know) but would be quite upset if it failed me again.

Tc0kA7rvOZ5fPOlCycWu8g.review_text: Alex and Jessie are the new owners and have really set up a great neighborhood cafe with excellent food AND friendly service. The place is nicely decorated, clean and they have tables where you can sit outside too. The food is consistently delicious, hardy portions,  affordable, excellent coffee drinks, cold beer, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, free wifi, dog friendly, amazing happy hour! (3 bucks for a great glass of wine! ) and service with a genuine smile. Alex and Jessie and their staff are some of the nicest people you will meet, even at 7 am in the morning! What more can you want?  They have a great selection of food , yummy deserts (love  the muffins and  pecan pie). Always fresh.  You can't go wrong with this place.

jvahIXlThqHfD_cDfv1HwA.review_text: Brekki menu selection was pretty small and I definitely didn't see things on offer like some of what's shown in the pics within this place's Photo feed, mainly typical fare such as wraps, sandwiches, bagels, all very bread heavy.  Came here because of the pics and reviews of the coffee but was disappointed as there definitely wasn't the foam art (which to me, shows attention to detail) and my cappuccino was realllllllly sweet despite not asking for any sugars, perhaps it's the soy that they use?  I'll try Pat's cafe tmrw as its right around the corner and looks like it has potential.

5npX5wCH7bOk_UAvnfFdDw.review_text: This review is for lunch, which was really quite terrible.  I work in the area, was walking by, checked the Yelp reviews and immediately walked in.  The chicken and bacon salad sounded good so I ordered that.  I was terribly disappointed when it arrived.  The dressing was a disgustingly sweet poppy seed dressing, which didn't go with the salad AT ALL, the bacon was chewy and gross, and the chicken was barely edible.  There were also a couple thin slices of flavorless tomato on the salad.   For over $10, it wasn't worth it at all.  I wouldn't go back.

jnmczPEkhRsUFos_nBPjTA.review_text: I'm disheartened. This has been my go-to coffee on uncountable weekends of reading in the sunny sidewalk or writing in one of the inside tables. I've been coming here for years and have seen different owners putting their own stamp in the place. Always having the delicious hummus plate. Always introducing the place to friend in and out of the neighborhood. Always raving about it. Until now. It's been a while since I last came here because the last time had left a sour taste in my mouth. What was once a very friendly service became not only unfriendly, but but disturbing. And today I hit an experience that makes my body cringe with the idea of ever coming back and being treated this way, as if I were doing them a favor for ordering, as if I did something really wrong just for being there, as if I am were a lier. I leave the comfort of my place to go work at a coffee shop so I can have the convenience of coffee, tea and snacks made for me, but also so I can interact with others, smile and smile back, spread love and grace. It's sad for me to see a place where instead of that, I get contempt and scorn. A place filled with people that look like they are hating to be there and hating to have to do something for me. I grieve, Capriccio, and hope that things turn around. Until then, I will explore one of the many options that north beach blessed me with.

uvI72KK0lmzv7_CFexU2-Q.review_text: Decent enough. Good wifi, pretty good breakfast. A bit of a snooty attitude toward customers. I am sorry that I don't know your rules about not being able to carry something out if it was missing from a table. There is a nicer way to let me know then to say you have other things to do inside.   Otherwise everything was fine.

JVTcskIsqBgyw7jTQC9GYQ.review_text: I had a good latte here. It's tough not to enjoy this place. The cafe is comfortable and makes you want to lounge for awhile. Win.

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: Love the outdoor seating here. This place (along with Cafe Francisco) doesn't get a lot of traffic because it's off the beaten path of Columbus St./North Beach territory. They make good coffee, iced/hot tea, cheese, beer, sandwiches, pastries, etc. They also have free wi-fi and friendly service. I have no problem with this place. Even the prices are decent for North Beach food/drinks. It's just a bit small. Oh! And, it has solid background music.

Zmmvs60O_fy_Vzs5HntRqg.review_text: Pretty standard menu. As for our meals, I was neither impressed or disappointed. Fairly expensive considering the simplicity of the menu-- could be due to location. Our ham and cheese croissant tasted like it had been nuked in a microwave, but they were willing to make a dish for me that isn't on their menu, so they definitely won me over with that

aJbXWA8OuA4mx0B67dXwNw.review_text: I've been waiting, since I  moved here, to visit this cafe- so I'll say that's 2 years but I could be off by months. It opens! And it's far better than I dreamed! Not exaggerating. OK maybe a tad. I've gone here twice now, and each time was great. We're so spoiled in this part of town- there must be a cafe with a block because damn if I don't need another espresso to keep awake, so I can go back to wine & pasta tonight. What this cafe offers is a slightly European flair from Sapore or 901 Columbus. It also offers an affordable menu of sandwiches and great outside seating on a relatively quiet block for Northern North Beach. Note: twice, my companions compared it to Noe Valley! I kid you not. Glad they finally opened. And the wi-fi is very appreciated.

w-a3z9o6y8-m2w-NMW2S3g.review_text: Came here for breakfast. The berry pie was really good. I also like the almond croissant. The place was clean and had nice facilities. The coffee was pretty good. Definitely will return here for a good breakfast with friends. Pleasant place to talk and plan a day.

a265T9fa0U9paf4iCirlgw.review_text: I live just around the corner from Capriccio and have been coming here for years. I am happy to say that it is a true neighborhood gem- which is tough in North Beach when you're so close to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The current staff, especially the baristas, seriously know their coffee. Whether you prefer an espresso drink, or a drip coffee, its all amazing. Nothing beats grabbing a book or magazine and heading to Capriccio on a weekend morning to sit outside on the sidewalk in the sun, drinking a soy latte, and reading. (Inside is good too- the music is always delightful)  Minus one star only because sometimes I come in to read or study, and all the tables are occupied by hipsters on their macs leeching free wi-fi.

pFFl_PTR-qHOoqaJu4XKag.review_text: Ooh, a Yelp first for me. It's a real-time review, yo. As I write, I am sitting in a very comfortable chair in the front corner of Cafe Capriccio. And, of course, this is all made possible by the fact that Cafe Capriccio offers free Wifi (You get two stars for that CC!).   I've just finished the Roast Beef Chedder Melt (as recommended by what seems to be a very helpful and decently nice staff), I hope the staff doesn't worry that I am judging them, even though I am. They're doing a good job. Handling customers swiftly and with a smile, I have been here for about 45 minutes and they haven't even shot me dirty looks despite the fact that I forgot to put pants on today. (Okay, I didn't really forget. I have dubbed this day "No Pants Friday." Feel free to celebrate with me.)  The crowd is acceptable. No scary people. No crazy people (which is a nice break), There's a baby. But don't worry, the baby is with his parents. It's not like he's just a random baby grabbing a cup of coffee. That would be weird. He has two people taking care of him. Hope they aren't kidnappers. Hmm, better get a closer look. The guy does have a beard, but he seems to be on the up and up.  Ok, so back to my lunch. I gotta say, it wasn't far away from great. The roast beef seemed like it came from my mom's oven instead of a deli freezer. The cheddar was quite melty and the panini bread was crisp, but maybe a little crummy for my tastes. But then, I am a super sloppy eater, and I was destined to get flakes of bread all over my hoodie. So I won't fault CC for that.  I'd love to tell you about the coffee, but I had to walk here, and I am a large man, so I was sweating when I got here. Therefore, I went for the iced coffee, which is pretty good, but isn't one iced coffee the same as all the rest? I say yes.  Wanna talk decor? I do. Hmm I am looking around right now. There is a very large painting of fish swimming around. I do not know what this means in an arty sense. There are some other paintings that make no sense. But they're nice. Then there is a giant painting of a rhino with zebra stripes. I don't know what this means either, but it is kinda cool. I mean, it's better than hanging up paint-by-numbers or your 5-year old nephew's (probably terrible) drawing of his family. They also have those lights that hang down. I don't know what those are called, but they make me feel like I'm in a trendy place. And that is exactly what I want when I am trying to be trendy in North Beach on a Friday.  So let's summarize: Free wifi, good roast beef sandwich, nice staff who don't subscribe to the tyranny of pants, babies with parents, art. So really, I have very few complaints about Cafe Capriccio.  I'll come here again.

KSWYGDjS99pmJ4CgIJ6lKg.review_text: Fantastic cappuccino and espresso. It is the closest good coffee we found to our hotel at Fisherman's wharf- it was definitely worth the walk!

nAbwXrHgJx5BshmOcCRCZQ.review_text: 5 star croissants and other quality eats & drinks!  I can't give the place 5 because the prices run a little high to me - but it's a solid 4 for sure.    CROISSANTS- you want these - especially first thing in the morning. Story round here: the owner wakes up at 4am to make sure these are baked fresh by 7am.    This is probably the 2nd best almond croissant I have had in SF, a good contender for those in Marin County. Without exposing my dirty past here, lets just say that I grew up with mad croissant hook-ups in Sausalito, Mill Valley, Larkspur and San Rafael from establishments that cater to European tourists.  I was an overstuffed child with a mother who thought good parenting meant pimping European butter to me like I was one of her clients. And sadly, I've been bribed with food since I can remember - not naming any names, but I kept secrets for a certain baby sitter in exchange for bags of croissants from a touristy spot in Tiburon.  I hit em hard but I also flipped a great deal.  My point is that I have had my share of croissants and this ish right here is - bomB!  Worth blowing up for.  TAKE EM HOME FOR BRUNCH My girl sometimes brings them home when we prep brunch.  Anything within a block under $10 that makes me wanna sing, has the potential to become part of me.  I've been good about these until recently.  Your warning: these aren't sweet, but the toasted almond one can produce bad girl affects.  Butter, fingers, lips, hips, swallow, singing in public - "pour some [butta] on mey."  Not sure you wanna hit this.  SCENE We have been neighbors for almost three years.  This is one of my go-tos to get stuff done because I like that my neighbors pop in and other students hang around to study.  They have wifi, outlets, pillows, and a fair amount of seating.  It can get busy, but I've never had trouble.  The staff is way kicked back even after a spill- I like that.  The music is always crack'n - a few times I have had to whip out Shazam.  I don't know who puts together their playlists but I would probably buy their mixed CD.    OTHER FOOD & DRINK TIPS - I'LL BE BRIEF Do get: mocha, latte, cappuccino DON'T get: regular coffee Do get: yogurt Parfait, salads, wraps, caprese sandwich, paninis, bagels w/ bacon egg and cheese, vegan donuts, warm baguette w/ nutella, pie, and pastries. Beer includes Big Daddy, Deschutes' Black Butte (love), Hef, Fat tire, Peroni.  Wine changes.  SPECIAL NOTE: DON'T get the prosciutto sandwich if you don't like prosciutto - no matter how bomb it looks.  Really, it's a beautiful mountain of raw pig, everyone else is eating it.  However, if that is not your thing - stick to your guns. Pulling prosciutto out of your panini here will get you dirty looks like you're sacreligious.

QjygwsEjxJvrTV3OsCS57Q.review_text: Coffee only review: good pouring skills, the cappuccino is good, but the mocha is way too sweet...  They also have a phone QR based system for buy 10 get 1 free! :p

KMrPwTZjVvNtZaxZIFuXHg.review_text: Fantastic coffee, one of the bestin northbeach

r72ak0EL6xP0-zW2ZfL1tw.review_text: Real barristas. This was a near perfect latte. We went on different days and had different barristas...same quality.

LJcQhKpUozHdgikIsiqjIQ.review_text: Food: Delicious. Blueberry pie made from scratch with real blueberries.  Coffee: The real deal -- French Press, full of flavor. Service: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful when I needed to ask about ingredients due to a food allergy. Speed: The only place a star was lost. They're making everything for you (no pre-packaged junk), so it's understandable, it would just be a deal breaker on a work day when I needed to get somewhere quickly.

Jt76kMkWSAJyWVvc4hcMEA.review_text: Best espresso/latte/mocha I've had at least since Cafe Organica (Grove and Central, circa 2006) was around.  In reality, this is probably even better.    Yes, I've been to Ritual, Blue Bottle, Fourbarrel since Organica closed.  This place still wins.    Hooray for badass coffee in the neighborhood!

D1nCb4_lI-6n0peIgg97vg.review_text: I'm actually sitting inside this Cafe as I'm typing this!  I really like this place--it has benches in the back that are comfortable to sit on and allow you to spread your stuff if the cafe isn't busy. They also have pillows, which is a nice touch! The exterior and interior are adorable, and very homey. It's quiet, the workers seem nice, and it wasn't too crowded.  I had a single-shot macchiato and the roasted chicken panini. I'm no ~coffee expert, but the macchiato was delicious, with a cute little leaf pattern on top, and the panini was great--it had a little side salad to it, which was nice.   PLUS! The most important thing to me--they have free wireless! It's fast and free.

A0jt8dFusg__JgVprDmNZA.review_text: Tried out this place because of the good reviews and the $15 for $10 yelp deal. When I presented the deal to the cashier he looked like he had no idea what I was talking about. Eventually they figured it out and I got the deal but it's always awkward when you feel you're holding up the whole line. My friend had iced tea and a bagel and I had the iced coffee and yogurt parfait, my only complaint was the iced coffee wasn't the greatest but the food was good. There was plenty of outdoor seating and it's a fairly quiet neighborhood so it's a good choice if you're in the North Beach/ Russian Hill area.

k6zYbMle3LI9jhMuY4Tc4w.review_text: Attention coffee shops! Offer your Americano in 8 oz/extra small cups! ESPECIALLY if you already have the cups in stock! Every good coffee shop (Reveille, Coffee Bar, Trieste, Beacon, Blue Bottle, Coffee Cultures, every cafe outside the US...) will give you this option, because this ratio of espresso to water is much stronger/better.   Tried to order Americano here in 8 oz cup (stacked next to register), even though paying for 12 oz. Guy/manager confirms and says no problem. I remind barista (and point to cup) bc it took awhile to get to my drinks. She also says no problem. But then starts making drink in 12 oz cup? I ask her to stop, but she says "Look at the menu. An Americano only comes in a 12 oz" and hands me a drink filled to the brim. Huh? Just use less water? I know it all sounds trivial, and it's not like I didn't drink it, but I just get irritated when people blindly follow procedures without thinking, and are rude in the process.  Bumping this from 1 to 2 stars because the manager was really nice. I stupidly spilled a second drink I had ordered all over the sidewalk, and he offered to give me a replacement. I thanked him, but said I didn't have time (it took 20 minutes to get these two drinks!) and that I'd rather not order again from that barista. In the end though, I have too many other great coffee shops in my neighborhood to frequent this place again.

VT5lqS__Ev8v3FE8bpi0gg.review_text: I'm not too familiar with San Francisco or the Bay Area but happened to come across Cafe Capriccio and their Yelp offer while I was near the area. The 4.5 star rating and hundreds of reviews, along with a Yelp deal made it a must try for us.   The cafe itself has an inside and outdoor seating area. Since the inside was packed at 11am on a Monday, we ate outside on the sidewalk. A nice, quiet, comfortable eating area with very few distractions. I could easily have spent a few hours just chit chatting and reading a book. The unisex restroom inside was very clean (important!!!) and the workers behind the counter provided great service.   The food was also delicious. I got a Caprese panini with a glass of unsweetened ice tea and it hit the spot. The ingredients inside tasted fresh and simple, no unnecessary flavoring. The bread may have been a little too hard for my taste but my friend disagreed with me 100%.  Next time I'm in SF, I'll certainly be coming back! Even without a Yelp deal...

1szMCSQX8nRn3Donr4R60A.review_text: I really enjoyed this place. I had a salmon bagel and a mocha. Both were great. The employees were very friendly and helpful.  The outdoor seating was a plus as well. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

FmS_qwo7hds1dHner5vjgQ.review_text: A - List. Location. Great Drinks and Food. Comfortable & Friendly. This is a great place to start off the day or meet up with friends later. For a small operation, this is pretty much as good as it gets. Miss this place badly.

iVxpHjBplVQHgVxtbUKPxw.review_text: I wish I could put this place in my pocket and bring it back to MA with me.   Before I get into any details, I'll preface this review with: I'm not from San Francisco. I'm from Boston, a place that has very few wine bars, so most of the wine bars I've been to are out of state. I've been to San Francisco a total of 3 times, Napa twice. I'm a wine lover. I'm a food lover.   That being said...this is one of my favorite places in San Fran. We came across this neighborhood gem a couple days into our trip and stopped in 3 times before heading back home, twice on the same day.   The staff is great, so friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable about their wines.  The food was delicious. We didn't try much more than breakfast and a snack, but the egg wrap, the oatmeal with fruit, the bagel sandwich, hot chocolate, and cheese plate were all good... The seats are cozy.  They have free wi-fi.  They played great music every time we went.  They have a wine bar. How many cafes do you know of with a wine bar?  Their wines and wine flights are priced right and their selections are really good. Not to mention that the $9 wine flight essentially gets you 3 full glasses of wine...or maybe we just lucked out. Either way, I love this place!    If I lived in San Francisco, I would make this my neighborhood place. I miss Cafe Capriccio already and am sad I couldn't bring it with me to the east coast.   Do yourself a favor and stop by for some breakfast, lunch, or a glass of wine. You won't regret it.

fgvkzqk6wtgO-kshU3TOSw.review_text: Free wifi. Great coffee. Great food/well priced. Friendly service. We had breakfast twice during our 4 day stay. Highly recommended.

zwOxvLSjQ7yhRMzQOgYemA.review_text: CostCo quality pastry and Folger's level coffee. Real garbage that I couldn't even finish. Listen, everyone has a right to their opinion but, really, if you're giving this place more than one star you're an idiot.  UPDATED 10/22/10:   Apparently, my review hit a nerve with Yelper, Pamela P., who wrote a compliment to me that read:  "When you write a review about another city's cafe ( capriccio) make sure you understand and research who has the top 10 coffee in the city. you top rated some shitty cafes and probally do serve costco pastries. so please dont act like your shit doesnt stink. and keep your ass in LA."  Okay, first reaction: Must. Stop. Laughing.   Second reaction: Intuition. I can only assume this "compliment" was written by the management and/or staff defending this dump, which kinda square roots 'pathetic' by a factor of one hundred... plus five. I'm talking PATHETIC here, like the sweaty guys in the back row of the Pussycat Theater (So I've heard).  Third impression: Logic. Pamela, honey, I don't actually have to "research" anything. I paid my money and in return was served a cinnamon bun of sadness and a cup of raw sewage. I now have the right to offer an opinion on the sad state of affairs that operates the business known as Capriccio.   Fourth impression: Reason, mixed with paternalism. Pammie, my opinion is just as valid as yours, if exponentially sophisticated in comparison, if I don't say so myself. Where was I? Oh, yeah. You wrote the following review of "Cako Bakery" on 1/29/10:  "This place is HORRIBLE!!  yes it might look "nice" and "welcoming" when you pass by, but there cupcakes suck! there dry and don't have a lot of good flavor. i was digging the fro-yo place that was there before. the staff is rude and isnt happy to sell cake! all in all.. something better needs to go in this spot. k thanks! :)"  You see what I'm sayin'? Glass houses and all that. What, you never heard of glass houses? It's in the bible. Psych! It's not.   Fifth impression: Empathy. Think about test driving a spellchecker.   Sixth impression: Pride. I actually have a pretty nice ass. Really. You should see it sometime.  ;)
